(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-04 08:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Agreed with Jesse there.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-04 08:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from inventory-update to new-project-functional-tests'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-04 08:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from inventory-update to new-project-functional-tests'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-04 11:44:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

If your aim is to fix the functional tests, please ensure that the tests [1] are changed to voting and present in the check & gate queues as part of this review so that the results are not false positives.

Second, keystone's failing because you're missing passing the USER environment variable in the tox config. See [2] for what's missing.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_masakari/blob/master/zuul.d/project.yaml#L20-L22
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/blob/master/tox.ini#L17"}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-04 12:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-04 12:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from inventory-update to new-project-functional-tests'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-05 11:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-05 11:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from inventory-update to new-project-functional-tests'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-06-05 12:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

functional test are gone!'}]

commit_message:
Fix functional test

Added variables in default/main.yml that were giving undefined
variable error while running functional test.

Change-Id: Ie8e1e3205b9a25821cca57cfda5603e47d003c8e

commit_message:
tasks: repo_build_wheels: Collect more information from the wheel build

In order to be able to debug wheel build failures it's helpful to
collect more information like the constrains which are used as well
as making the build more verbose.

Change-Id: I1e8aa9e27c6b9581c09db59dc9349b5658299a86

In order to prevent the play proceeding without at least one repo master
server selected, add an assertion task to fail if the repo_masters group
is not registered by the preceding task.

Change-Id: I8a5e74816792aee7c74f18364f67851491f05f9a
'}, {'created': '2018-09-24 01:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'Assert repo_masters group is registered

In order to prevent the play proceeding without at least one repo master
server selected, add an assertion task to fail if the repo_masters group
is not registered by the preceding task.

Closes-Bug: 1793999

Change-Id: I8a5e74816792aee7c74f18364f67851491f05f9a
'}]
commit_message:
Assert repo_masters group is registered

In order to prevent the play proceeding without at least one repo master
server selected, add an assertion task to fail if the repo_masters group
is not registered by the preceding task.

Closes-Bug: 1793999

Change-Id: I8a5e74816792aee7c74f18364f67851491f05f9a

commit_message:
[cinder] create pike-em tag against final releases

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by
creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: Id38ffe10afb38fcf0f6fe1de00014d5002280d85

commit_message:
Include nova::availability_zone in scheduler.pp

nova-scheduler uses CONF.default_availabiliy_zone.
However, the required class was not included in scheduler.pp
This patch includes nova::availability_zone class in scheduler.pp.

Signed-off-by: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1824273
Change-Id: Ia94a5d7baf1dd2efc8339475176a1e1c24ad99d0
(cherry picked from commit fd7587d71fd6dd6af6a95104e538d8f04ae9dd5e)

Ceph Nautilus has now a stable release 14.2.0 and it's being packaged
in CentOS Storage SIG. Mimic release was not LTS so let's replace it
by Nautilus where possible.

Since nautilus, the supported store backend is LVM which can use a block

commit_message:
Replace Ceph Mimic by Nautilus in CentOS

Ceph Nautilus has now a stable release 14.2.0 and it's being packaged
in CentOS Storage SIG. Mimic release was not LTS so let's replace it
by Nautilus where possible.

Since nautilus, the supported store backend is LVM which can use a block
device directly (not loopback) or a LVM logical volume for OSDs.

This patch is creating a LVM structure to create the OSD used to
validate Ceph and switching scenario004 to use nautilus instead of
mimic, so we will keep testing both Luminous and Nautilus, LTS releases.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650263/
Change-Id: I81441237a8b7cf651fa6926b2eb3c4ed0d42bb58
(cherry picked from commit f2b72455209ae79f4d1aa2e0a464fd4f1062b126)

a cleaner way to fetch the image from now on.

commit_message:
[tacker] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each deliverables ; and

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes since the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Don't tag python-tackerclient or tacker-horizon as they don't contain
any functional changes from already tagged and released versions.

Change-Id: Ife5dbd016149b3585ff0ecc41868d2564901668e

commit_message:
[kuryr] create pike-em tag against final releases

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by
creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

A few of these definitely do not have code changes and could be dropped.

That said, we added enforcement I think that all repos in a deliverable file need to be included in a release, so our only other option would be to break them out into a different file. Not worth it in my opinion.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-22 20:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-09 07:02:51.000000000', 'message': "Set member initializing state as OFFLINE

When a haproxy backend (an octavia member) is initializing, set member's
operational status to OFFLINE instead of ONLINE (member is not yet
functional)

It fixes an issue when haproxy configuration is reloaded while a member
is misconfigured/non-working and is in ERROR state, the member is
temporarily marked as ONLINE because haproxy is re-initializing its
backends.

Story: 2002118
Task: 19797

Change-Id: I5d2c434a41010a73564753bfcaef8ae9afb36b08
"}, {'created': '2019-04-09 11:47:13.000000000', 'message': "Set member initializing state as OFFLINE

functional)

It fixes an issue when haproxy configuration is reloaded while a member
is misconfigured/non-working and is in ERROR state, the member is
temporarily marked as ONLINE because haproxy is re-initializing its
backends.

Story: 2002118
Task: 19797

Change-Id: I5d2c434a41010a73564753bfcaef8ae9afb36b08

Story: 2002118
Task: 19797

Change-Id: I5d2c434a41010a73564753bfcaef8ae9afb36b08
"}]
commit_message:
Set member initializing state as OFFLINE

When a haproxy backend (an octavia member) is initializing, set member's
operational status to OFFLINE instead of ONLINE (member is not yet
functional)

It fixes an issue when haproxy configuration is reloaded while a member
is misconfigured/non-working and is in ERROR state, the member is
temporarily marked as ONLINE because haproxy is re-initializing its
backends.

Story: 2002118
Task: 19797

Change-Id: I5d2c434a41010a73564753bfcaef8ae9afb36b08

commit_message:
Switch to Debian Stretch for building CoreOS images

It seems that Jessie is no longer supported, and its backports repo
is no longer available, hence all CoreOS jobs fail.

Also install setuptools into the environment explicitly, since some
dependencies fail to install without it.

Change-Id: I751522209d07caa26422a75b108f8c8baf782028
(cherry picked from commit ac4904ed960dabe94a4b6a3ceff9b4038e61f24f)

commit_message:
Update links for opendev

The most important bits are updating shade references to remove
the openstack-infra. The other git urls will work through the
redirect, but cleaning them up is just nicer.

This removes two comments that reference files that no longer
exist due to config generation.

Also, fix some random use of github for cloning openstack repos,
since the github mirror is best-effort only.

commit_message:
Make scenario00{1,4} non-voting

To make ceph-nautilus migration happen without breaking tripleo-ci,
scenario00{1,4} are turned non-voting and they're removed from the
gate queue.
When the migration process is completed, this commit will be
reverted.

Change-Id: I3ce12c5e56a723e9cdcb304f27ad44e458b85a89

commit_message:
Update links for opendev

The most important bits are updating shade references to remove
the openstack-infra. The other git urls will work through the
redirect, but cleaning them up is just nicer.

This removes two comments that reference files that no longer
exist due to config generation.

Also, fix some random use of github for cloning openstack repos,
since the github mirror is best-effort only.

Conflicts:
	doc/source/user/troubleshooting.rst

commit_message:
Update links for opendev

The most important bits are updating shade references to remove
the openstack-infra. The other git urls will work through the
redirect, but cleaning them up is just nicer.

This removes two comments that reference files that no longer
exist due to config generation.

Also, fix some random use of github for cloning openstack repos,
since the github mirror is best-effort only.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

commit_message:
Remove pylxd before 2.2.7

Any pylxd version before 2.2.7 fails to build now that
urllib3 1.25 is out. This removes them, and therefore
allows us to build requirements for older openstack
branches than Rocky.

See also https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655498/

Change-Id: I632f648f59020a2010ffe05f59ca634461752997

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 14:47:13.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to have RabbitMQ do its own SSL

This is necessary if you'd like to secure RabbitMQ traffic. The HAProxy
solution has a number of disadvantages, and RabbitMQ/erlang are very
good at providing native TLS/SSL.

The options for CA certs and keys and such can be handled in
inventory/globals/passwords. By default this will do nothing and users
who want TLS/SSL for their RabbitMQ can do so via HAProxy.

Change-Id: I0e56ffd2e4412bad6e968759630b6cbfe2a246bb
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to have RabbitMQ do its own SSL

This is necessary if you'd like to secure RabbitMQ traffic. The HAProxy
solution has a number of disadvantages, and RabbitMQ/erlang are very
good at providing native TLS/SSL.

The options for CA certs and keys and such can be handled in
inventory/globals/passwords. By default this will do nothing and users
who want TLS/SSL for their RabbitMQ can do so via HAProxy.

commit_message:
Add iDRAC driver realtime RAID creation and deletion

It adds capability to the idrac driver for creating and deleting
RAID sets without rebooting the bare metal node.


Change-Id: I3f4282afff860d9771a3d37f4d5e1172d88e87a3
Story: 2004861

commit_message:
Switch OBS mirror to branch for stabilization

Instead of pointing to Virtualization:containers point to a branch.
This will give us more control over what package versions the project
contains.

Change-Id: I2acd0ccc0f0c303ab9d0d999f471c9192c569f60
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 09:37:40.000000000', 'message': "Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
(cherry picked from commit aa58fbcacfdc14bb2e8d5a4ff1ef7a47fe9268d0)
"}, {'created': '2019-04-03 03:07:56.000000000', 'message': "Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
(cherry picked from commit aa58fbcacfdc14bb2e8d5a4ff1ef7a47fe9268d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Load existing resources using correct environment

In convergence we were loading resources from the database using the
current environment. This is incorrect when a previous update has
failed, meaning the resources in the database were created with a
non-current template and environment. If an attempt was made to change
the type of a resource but that resource was never updated, this will
result in us loading a resource with the wrong type. If the type has
been removed then it can result in errors just trying to show the stack.

Note that the Resource.load() method used during a convergence traversal
already does the Right Thing - it only uses the new type if it is a
valid substitution for the old type, and UpdateReplace is later raised
in Resource.update_convergence() if the type does not match in that
specified in the new environment. So we don't see any problems with
stack updates, just with API calls.

Since we cannot change the signature of Resource.__new__() without also
modifying the signature of __init__() in every resource plugin that has
implemented it (many of which are out of tree), instead substitute the
stack definition for the duration of creating the Resource object. This
will result in stack.env returning the environment the resource was last
updated with.

Change-Id: I3fbd14324fc4681b26747ee7505000b8fc9439f1
Story: #2005090
Task: 29688
(cherry picked from commit aa58fbcacfdc14bb2e8d5a4ff1ef7a47fe9268d0)

commit_message:
Remove python3.5 jobs for Train

The TC has decided that python 3.5 tests are not required for Train
forward[1]. This patch removes the python 3.5 jobs from Octavia.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/ \
    005097.html

Change-Id: Ic75cb45f7c89a80b779ade18a9e4a6f7bf1a6847

commit_message:
Fix spurious nagios alerts for radosgw service.

Currently, when the charm tears down the default radosgw daemon in
order to make way for per host daemons, it does not remove the nrpe
check for the daemon. This PR fixes the issue.

It also closes a gap where alerts for the per host daemons are not
setup until a hook that happens to call update_nrpe_checks as a
side-effect is run.

Change-Id: I7621b9671b010a77bb3e94bdd1e80f45274c73e5
Closes-Bug: #1825843

commit_message:
Fix spurious nagios alerts for radosgw service.

Currently, when the charm tears down the default radosgw daemon in
order to make way for per host daemons, it does not remove the nrpe
check for the daemon. This PR fixes the issue.

It also closes a gap where alerts for the per host daemons are not
setup until a hook that happens to call update_nrpe_checks as a
side-effect is run.

Change-Id: I7621b9671b010a77bb3e94bdd1e80f45274c73e5
Closes-Bug: #1825843

Got rid of fussiness around type of checks_to_remove var

Change-Id: I09616fe0a34a61198de74ce0160c61812ca2624d

Added tests!

Change-Id: I6458ff86ab16b7f710d72584c6b2f2ef533a5f7f

commit_message:
tripleo-bootstrap: ensure network service is enabled & started

We are using 'network' service provided by 'network-scripts' which is
deprecated in RHEL8/CentOS8/Fedora28 but os-net-config doesn't support yet
NetworkManager. Until it happens, we need to ensure that network is started
at boot, as it'll take care of restarting the network interfaces managed by
OVS. Note that OVS unit service is already configure to start before
network.service.
See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1701866 for context.

Change-Id: Ib2ca3830e3c3a79cdea93cdb8976757d0697811d

commit_message:
Track neutron uwsgi jobs move to check queue

Neutron has had functional, fullstack, and tempest jobs configured for
uwsgi for some time but they were in the experimental queue.  Now that
they are moving to the check queue, track them in Grafana.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/655233
Change-Id: Ib83a8dca9871386fe86684088401024be8e88734

commit_message:
Add glance, tempest, and nova stable* to ceph grafana

This adds the glance and tempest projects to the ceph failure rate
tracking dashboard. It also adds the nova stable branches to the view.
Finally, the default time period is changed to the last 7 days and the
panel width increased to look better (idea stolen from the neutron
grafana dashboard).

Change-Id: I0f099a615b511b64f2347dbb322bcf3d29ac2bef

commit_message:
Fix spurious nagios alerts for radosgw service.

Currently, when the charm tears down the default radosgw daemon in
order to make way for per host daemons, it does not remove the nrpe
check for the daemon. This PR fixes the issue.

It also closes a gap where alerts for the per host daemons are not
setup until a hook that happens to call update_nrpe_checks as a
side-effect is run.

Change-Id: I7621b9671b010a77bb3e94bdd1e80f45274c73e5
Closes-Bug: #1825843

Got rid of fussiness around type of checks_to_remove var

Change-Id: I09616fe0a34a61198de74ce0160c61812ca2624d

Added tests!

Change-Id: I6458ff86ab16b7f710d72584c6b2f2ef533a5f7f

commit_message:
Reuse checksum calculation from oslo

This is brought up during the implementation of agent http
provisioning [1], since oslo provides checksum calculation
via oslo_utils.fileutils.compute_file_checksum, we'd better
use that instead of reimplement our own [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565474/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/common/utils.py#L232-L251

Change-Id: Ibb7eceeeff78b40bec34b859311ec0d95cfa8093
Story: 2003798
Task: 26526
(cherry picked from commit 87502af1c03357b47e8180471e51d86f37f981e2)

[{'created': '2019-04-15 11:55:00.000000000', 'message': 'Ansible module: fix clean error handling

It should not be up to the driver to handle the error. The error should
reach the manager. Moreover, handling the error in the driver and
returning nothing caused the manager to consider the step done and go to
the next one instead of interrupting the cleaning workflow

Change-Id: I3825838b5507bc735d983466aa3cac0edd4dfaca
Story: #2005357
Task: #30315
(cherry picked from commit df5261bb349dd56ac88876e14779d244bdc0beb3)

commit_message:
Ansible module: fix clean error handling

It should not be up to the driver to handle the error. The error should
reach the manager. Moreover, handling the error in the driver and
returning nothing caused the manager to consider the step done and go to
the next one instead of interrupting the cleaning workflow

Change-Id: I3825838b5507bc735d983466aa3cac0edd4dfaca
Story: #2005357
Task: #30315
(cherry picked from commit df5261bb349dd56ac88876e14779d244bdc0beb3)

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match
up otherwise devstack fails in CI to clone as cloning
is blocked if not in the projects list... Which it is,
as x/pyghmi.

Change-Id: I87bdf65dd2dac189642d0af6def2d0ed155f3c00

commit_message:
Fix pyghmi path

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match
up otherwise devstack fails in CI to clone as cloning
is blocked if not in the projects list... Which it is,
as x/pyghmi.

Change-Id: I87bdf65dd2dac189642d0af6def2d0ed155f3c00
(cherry picked from commit bb8101ca950819a4d55af18d57b53c15ef51c836)

subject: Bump pylxd to 2.2.7

can 2.2.5 not be built with the queens constraint?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:01:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> can 2.2.5 not be built with the queens constraint?

It can but due to what I think is a pip bug it has to be done in 2 steps

 virtualenv -p python2 LXD
 LXD/bin/pip install -c https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/queens pylxd

#fail

 LXD/bin/pip install -c https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/queens requests
 LXD/bin/pip install -c https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/queens pylxd

# success 

I don't have ready access to see who uses pylxd, and IIRC hound currently isn't working

I think in general I;m okay with this and it's supported by the stable policy."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

only nova-lxd it seems

| nova-lxd     | requirements.txt                                         |   13 | pylxd>=2.2.6 # Apache-2.0'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-26 05:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Bump pylxd to 2.2.7

We cannot build wheels for pylxd 2.2.5 anymore. Its 2.2.5 setup.py
file install_requires have no upper bound on requests, and wheel
cannot be built with latest requests.

Bumping to 2.2.7 is bumping to the lowest version which contains
a patch separating the install and setup_requires [1], allowing
us to build its wheels. Anything above the Queens branch is not
impacted by the issue.

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/pylxd/commit/4b8ab1802f9aee4eb29cf7b119dae0aa47150779

Change-Id: I97b909385a8e6778a1a09afb26b8c33be1f294ca

commit_message:
Run nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py on every deploy run

Change I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961 moved the dicovery
to run on a single compute host to not race on simultanious nova-manage
commands. This change make sure we run the discover on every deploy run
which is required for scaling up events.

Change-Id: I1312b73ea4978eb24e1a2a60efc21d365a097b4d
Related-bug: 1824445
(cherry picked from commit 096a90e91a8919046f97cbb18c0fa9018cd49757)

commit_message:
Run nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py on every deploy run

Change I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961 moved the dicovery
to run on a single compute host to not race on simultanious nova-manage
commands. This change make sure we run the discover on every deploy run
which is required for scaling up events.

Change-Id: I1312b73ea4978eb24e1a2a60efc21d365a097b4d
Related-bug: 1824445

(cherry picked from commit 096a90e91a8919046f97cbb18c0fa9018cd49757)

commit_message:
fix storage.yaml to write environments/storage/nova-nfs.yaml

753a3504184d966c63121ca95bc0135afbc83a75 removed ceph entries
from sample-env-generator/storage.yaml which resulted in nova-nfs
and cinder-netapp-config to be in the same section. Therefore
environment_generator.py did not update the nova-nfs.yaml .

Also add quotes to the nfs version as they are required in
the resulting nova-nfs.yaml .

Closes-Bug: #1825374

Change-Id: I209480f209e3a8841362ea619b1c9b073c89f338

The current listener API does not properly handle clearing/reseting

will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

(cherry picked from commit 930a3236bf7fd341b32ba41b2c99cd3ad832d709)

commit_message:
Fix listener API handling of None/null updates

The current listener API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. Some integer only fields, such as connection-limit,
will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the listener parameters.

Change-Id: I41c9bedd8a3452513af3d409fbacd65ea287f02a
Story: 2005374
Task: 30352
(cherry picked from commit 930a3236bf7fd341b32ba41b2c99cd3ad832d709)

Images with GPT partition tables could not be deployed correctly

Story: #2005357

'}]
commit_message:
Ansible module: fix partition_configdrive.sh file

Images with GPT partition tables could not be deployed correctly
The if condition could never be met due to an invalid syntax, leading to
partitioning failure

Change-Id: I11202b115f9b80e8c853dca36cc66ab0eb8f7dea
Story: #2005357
Task: #30317
(cherry picked from commit 84741e94095e2a7c07ff880a17983e373c28eab0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 22:34:15.000000000', 'message': 'Bind mount /run into chroot when installing grub

grub-mkconfig runs a lvs command that attempts to access /run/lvm
once for each block device, currently it times out after 10 seconds
for each device and moves on. Multiple 10 second delays become
a problem (causing IPA API timeouts) when multiple block devices
are present. Bind mounting in /run avoids the delay and the
timeouts.

Change-Id: Iae8b7808a35bff121f64971aadd4bd36b5f5bb71
'}, {'created': '2019-04-25 10:14:31.000000000', 'message': 'Bind mount /run into chroot when installing grub

grub-mkconfig runs a lvs command that attempts to access /run/lvm
once for each block device, currently it times out after 10 seconds
for each device and moves on. Multiple 10 second delays become
a problem (causing IPA API timeouts) when multiple block devices
are present. Bind mounting in /run avoids the delay and the
timeouts.

Task: 30616
Story: 2005507

Change-Id: Iae8b7808a35bff121f64971aadd4bd36b5f5bb71
'}, {'created': '2019-04-25 22:53:34.000000000', 'message': 'Bind mount /run into chroot when installing grub

grub-mkconfig runs a lvs command that attempts to access /run/lvm
once for each block device, currently it times out after 10 seconds
for each device and moves on. Multiple 10 second delays become
a problem (causing IPA API timeouts) when multiple block devices
are present. Bind mounting in /run avoids the delay and the
timeouts.

Task: 30616
Story: 2005507

Change-Id: Iae8b7808a35bff121f64971aadd4bd36b5f5bb71
'}]
commit_message:
Bind mount /run into chroot when installing grub

grub-mkconfig runs a lvs command that attempts to access /run/lvm
once for each block device, currently it times out after 10 seconds
for each device and moves on. Multiple 10 second delays become
a problem (causing IPA API timeouts) when multiple block devices
are present. Bind mounting in /run avoids the delay and the
timeouts.

Task: 30616
Story: 2005507

Change-Id: Iae8b7808a35bff121f64971aadd4bd36b5f5bb71

commit_message:
Remove crusty old python 3 package version logic

If we are running with python3, just assume that any
package that is not blacklisted is available for py3
and just attempt to install it and let pip sort it out
whether it gets installed from a local or remote package.

Change-Id: Ic05d183e489320f6dfc721575d47e7e4d661f87c
Closes-Bug: #1820892
(cherry picked from commit e03bcb2c8b8f1ee1cbef579454a30776e43175b3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 16:27:16.000000000', 'message': "Add support for Sphinx 2.0

Sphinx 2.0 switched the default HTML builder from HTML4 to HTML5 [1].
Since some of our tests are validating raw HTML output, this has caused
them to break. We can't drop support for Sphinx < 2.0 yet since Sphinx
2.0 doesn't support Python 2.7, so simply if-else this mofo until such a
time as we _can_ drop support.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/4587

Change-Id: I4631169908e34fa924f5a0a783a94ad9c1215d9f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for Sphinx 2.0

Sphinx 2.0 switched the default HTML builder from HTML4 to HTML5 [1].
Since some of our tests are validating raw HTML output, this has caused
them to break. We can't drop support for Sphinx < 2.0 yet since Sphinx
2.0 doesn't support Python 2.7, so simply if-else this mofo until such a
time as we _can_ drop support.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/4587

Change-Id: I4631169908e34fa924f5a0a783a94ad9c1215d9f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Add cinderlib project
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-21 10:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-02-21 12:15:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since this doesn't seem to be used in openstack itself, I don't think this code belongs into devstack. (But maybe I'm not understanding the whole picture here.)

Still, did you consider making this a devstack plugin within cinderlib? IMO that would be a better approach."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-26 08:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-27 13:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-27 13:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-01 06:41:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

My question from PS1 is still unanswered: Why can't this be a devstack plugin?"}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-01 09:31:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@frickler: Apologies, I missed your first comment, didn't mean to ignore it.

Cinderlib is tightly coupled with Cinder and we wanted to have them both in the same repository [1][2][3], but since we wanted to have 2 different PyPi packages it had to go on a different repository.

The idea of installing cinderlib whenever we install Cinder was to preserve this tight coupling and facilitate running the cinderlib functional tests in all Cinder and 3rd party Cinder CIs, as well as testing by developers that deploy Devstack without the need of extra steps.

If you don't think that's enough to submit the patch to devstack I'll go with the plugin route.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620669/
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620670/
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620671/"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-03-01 16:05:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

> @frickler: Apologies, I missed your first comment, didn't mean to
 > ignore it.
 > 
 > Cinderlib is tightly coupled with Cinder and we wanted to have them
 > both in the same repository [1][2][3], but since we wanted to have
 > 2 different PyPi packages it had to go on a different repository.
 > 
 > The idea of installing cinderlib whenever we install Cinder was to
 > preserve this tight coupling and facilitate running the cinderlib
 > functional tests in all Cinder and 3rd party Cinder CIs, as well as
 > testing by developers that deploy Devstack without the need of
 > extra steps.
 > 
 > If you don't think that's enough to submit the patch to devstack
 > I'll go with the plugin route.
 > 
 > [1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620669/
 > [2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620670/
 > [3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620671/


Thanks Gorka for the explanation. But I agree with frickler about doing this installation via devdtack plugin There will not be any issue in plugin case also even cinderlib is tightly coupled with cinder. 

Main requirement of cinderlib is it need cinder to be installed and configured first. Same thing can be confirmed by devstack-plugin approach where devstack-plugin will be called after cinder is installed by devstack. In cinderlib'devstack plugin you check the cinder installation and proceed. 

We do installation of other close lib like neutron-lib, os-vif along with used service neutron and nova. But cinderlib is not the same case of other library. cinderlib seems SDK of Cinder than common code library itself used by cinder."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-05 12:32:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thanks for the reviews.  I'll propose it as a plugin then."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-05 12:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Will be proposed as a plugin'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-04-26 08:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For reference the plugin is in the cinderlib repository: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/643014/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 10:54:28.000000000', 'message': "Add cinderlib project

Cinderlib is a library that provides direct usage of Cinder Block
Storage drivers without running any services.  So there's no need for
c-vol, c-api, c-sch, c-bak, or MariaDB or RabbitMQ.

The project is different from other libraries, since OpenStack projects
don't consume it.  Instead it consumes the Cinder project as if it were
a library.

This patch adds the cinderlib installation to devstack and defaults to
installing from git instead of pypi like non-library projects.  To
achieve this and still support installing from pypi we add the new
LIBS_FROM_PYPI configuration option, which is equivalent to existing
LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Cinderlib will be installed whenever Cinder is.  This way 3rd party CIs
will be able to easily run cinderlib functional tests when they run
normal Cinder tempest tests without needing to run a new job, thus
saving deployment time.

Change-Id: Ib22d380eb9772ac9f0e68b3d2901743ca729ea6d

commit_message:
Add cinderlib project

Cinderlib is a library that provides direct usage of Cinder Block
Storage drivers without running any services.  So there's no need for
c-vol, c-api, c-sch, c-bak, or MariaDB or RabbitMQ.

The project is different from other libraries, since OpenStack projects
don't consume it.  Instead it consumes the Cinder project as if it were
a library.

This patch adds the cinderlib installation to devstack and defaults to
installing from git instead of pypi like non-library projects.  To
achieve this and still support installing from pypi we add the new
LIBS_FROM_PYPI configuration option, which is equivalent to existing
LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Cinderlib will be installed whenever Cinder is.  This way 3rd party CIs
will be able to easily run cinderlib functional tests when they run
normal Cinder tempest tests without needing to run a new job, thus
saving deployment time.

Change-Id: Ib22d380eb9772ac9f0e68b3d2901743ca729ea6d

commit_message:
Drop use of git.openstack.org

Our cgit instance will be going away and opendev.org is the new
preferred URL for browsing our git repos. Redirects will exist for the
foreseeable future, but it's more efficient to just go directly to the
new locations.

Change-Id: I4b7150e5116147c9be05fd9d698e7f3c747513a8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-08 21:33:53.000000000', 'message': "Delete require_instance_exists_using_uuid

This decorator is extremely old, virtual_interface_get_by_instance
started using it in 0d9d2487e2ca921ab54b1ecbe359c32ce8fb0c48 (Folsom).

virtual_interface_get_by_instance is the only thing still using it
and doesn't need to. The only thing which calls that DB API is
VirtualInterfaceList.get_by_instance_uuid and everything calling that
handles an empty list (and InstanceNotFound is probably unexpected
in anything using those anyway, i.e. they'd need to already get the
instance to lookup the VIFs).

The decorator is also not fast - it calls instance_get_by_uuid
which builds up a query on the Instance model and also joins on
the metadata and system_metadata tables which is totally unnecessary
for an existence type check.

Anyway, there seems to be no good reason for having that decorator
anymore as nothing else uses it, for example
block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance.

Change-Id: I7dcb47f916908319ae58db12e9ab3dd8dad9ff39
Closes-Bug: #1823794
"}]
commit_message:
Delete require_instance_exists_using_uuid

This decorator is extremely old, virtual_interface_get_by_instance
started using it in 0d9d2487e2ca921ab54b1ecbe359c32ce8fb0c48 (Folsom).

virtual_interface_get_by_instance is the only thing still using it
and doesn't need to. The only thing which calls that DB API is
VirtualInterfaceList.get_by_instance_uuid and everything calling that
handles an empty list (and InstanceNotFound is probably unexpected
in anything using those anyway, i.e. they'd need to already get the
instance to lookup the VIFs).

The decorator is also not fast - it calls instance_get_by_uuid
which builds up a query on the Instance model and also joins on
the metadata and system_metadata tables which is totally unnecessary
for an existence type check.

Anyway, there seems to be no good reason for having that decorator
anymore as nothing else uses it, for example
block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance.

Change-Id: I7dcb47f916908319ae58db12e9ab3dd8dad9ff39
Closes-Bug: #1823794

commit_message:
Update task state in context manager

This makes sure the task state is reset whenever the task is
finished (success or fail).

commit_message:
Add option to start subworkflow via RPC.

In case of several engine instances, starting subworkflows not in the
same instance with parent task, could significantly smooth load between
engine instances. Furthermore, starting workflow is not always
a lightweight operation and we should try to make it as more 'atomic'
as possible.

Change-Id: I895bee811496f920b075880a6c438c53f7ecb2ca
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use the 'real' name for the LXC image

The Open Build Service repository for the Leap 15.0 LXC image returns
a metalink which causes aria2c to download 2 files. The first is an
empty file (the metalink) and the second is the actual LXC image. The
name of the second file changes frequently.

This change uses the `--on-download-complete` callback of aria2c to
call a helper script which links the expected filename to the actual
filename.

Change-Id: I9a2bc7ded20f772af82956a81a9864c7ee17039c
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>

Since commit I8df8921337ea3f4e751c0c822d823e64e3ca7e1c

But it can be still used in workload stabilization.

commit_message:
Revert "Make git.openstack.org as default git server"

With the transition to opendev.org(no git.openstack.org now),
this change is no longer needed. The refs/changes are not
synched[1] to opendev.org so we can't use https://opendev.org
to Clone gated changes instead we need to use https://review.opendev.org.
Also this is a followup of [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655238/3
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/654606/

This reverts commit 74b1094b73884b4e1ba2b1e6f6204720d527b757.

Change-Id: Id9f4e7f3ef787d771ff51fa5d8ee7d8e11b1563b

subject: wsrep_slave_threads: default to 48 on bionic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8992, 'name': 'Billy Olsen', 'email': 'billy.olsen@canonical.com', 'username': 'billy-olsen'}, {'_account_id': 11237, 'name': 'Mario Splivalo', 'email': 'mario+launchpad@splivalo.hr', 'username': 'mariosplivalo'}, {'_account_id': 20634, 'name': 'Chris MacNaughton', 'email': 'chris.macnaughton@canonical.com', 'username': 'Chris.MacNaughton'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21107, 'name': 'Trent Lloyd', 'email': 'trent.lloyd@canonical.com', 'username': 'lathiat'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24824, 'name': 'Dmitrii Shcherbakov', 'email': 'dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com', 'username': 'dmitriis'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2019-04-09 07:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-04-09 08:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2019-04-09 23:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Changes look sane to me.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2019-04-10 02:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11237, 'date': '2019-04-10 15:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm inclined to leave the wsrep_slave_threads to the default option, as Galera documentation suggests.

That would also clear the confusion with xenial. My preference would be to have the charm option default to specific number ("1", as per my suggestion), rather than leaving the default empty and then letting the charm decide what option is best depending on the series being deployed.

FWIW, I think that the bug mentioned (LP #1823850) has been fixed some time ago, I just need to verify that. 

But, regardless, I'm still inclined to exposing that Galera option via the charm, but leaving the default to '1', as documentation suggests.'}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2019-04-11 00:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I'm inclined to leave the wsrep_slave_threads to the default
 > option, as Galera documentation suggests.
 > 
 > That would also clear the confusion with xenial. My preference
 > would be to have the charm option default to specific number ("1",
 > as per my suggestion), rather than leaving the default empty and
 > then letting the charm decide what option is best depending on the
 > series being deployed.
 > 
 > FWIW, I think that the bug mentioned (LP #1823850) has been fixed
 > some time ago, I just need to verify that.
 > 
 > But, regardless, I'm still inclined to exposing that Galera option
 > via the charm, but leaving the default to '1', as documentation
 > suggests.

Where does the Galera documentation suggest leaving it set to 1?

http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/performance.html
http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/mysqlwsrepoptions.html#wsrep-slave-threads

Both make no such suggestion.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-04-24 10:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

The docs say that:

"... Because of this, there is no strict formula to determine how many slave threads your node actually needs."

"Instead of concrete recommendations, there are some general guidelines that you can use as a starting point in finding the value that works best for your system..."

This makes sense to me - the number of threads needed would depend on a client application-specific load (variable per-connection) and the number of concurrent client connections so we can only choose an empirical value here and probably try to estimate if nothing is specified.

Since the solution is marked as partial I would go for it for now and discuss possible means of auto-calculating this value in a separate review.'}, {'account_id': 11237, 'date': '2019-04-24 13:40:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

After discussion with Trent I have changed my mind so I'm giving +1 on this too.

I would still go with the default of 8, as is default with Ubuntu package installed.

I don't think auto-calculation is worth the effort as that will greatly depend on the specific hardware configuration, workload, etc, etc..."}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-04-26 07:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-09 07:57:51.000000000', 'message': "wsrep_slave_threads: default to 48 on bionic

This improves performance significantly for environments constrained by
calls to sync() such as HDDs or lower-end SSDs (or just very busy
environments running many queries)

By default the the queries from other nodes are only processed with
1 thread, which means they will always run slower than on the master and
any long running query will hold up all other queries behind it.

Additionally, when multiple queries commit at once the server can
combine them together into a single on-disk sync ('group commit') which
is not possible otherwise. This optimisation appears to only occur on
Bionic (Percona 5.7) and not Xenial (Percona 5.6).

On Bionic, default to 48 threads which experimentally is a good number
for OpenStack environments without being too crazy high. Galera ensures
that queries that are dependent on each other are still executed
sequentially and generally it is not expected to cause replication
inconsistencies.

However Percona Cluster 5.6 on Xenial appears to have a bug handling
foreign key constraints that causes them to be violated (LP #1823850).
The result is that the slave node crashes out and has to do a full SST
to recover. The same issue is not present on the master. Thus we leave
the default wsrep_slave_threads=1 on Xenial to avoid this issue for now
particularly since Xenial does not appear to be able to use Group Commit
to optimise the number of sync requests generated by the queries - so
this option does not really improve performance there anyway.

Partial-Bug: #1822903
Change-Id: Ic9cdd6562f30a3e52aa3d26fea53ba7c2bbdc771
"}]
commit_message:
wsrep_slave_threads: default to 48 on bionic

This improves performance significantly for environments constrained by
calls to sync() such as HDDs or lower-end SSDs (or just very busy
environments running many queries)

By default the the queries from other nodes are only processed with
1 thread, which means they will always run slower than on the master and
any long running query will hold up all other queries behind it.

Additionally, when multiple queries commit at once the server can
combine them together into a single on-disk sync ('group commit') which
is not possible otherwise. This optimisation appears to only occur on
Bionic (Percona 5.7) and not Xenial (Percona 5.6).

On Bionic, default to 48 threads which experimentally is a good number
for OpenStack environments without being too crazy high. Galera ensures
that queries that are dependent on each other are still executed
sequentially and generally it is not expected to cause replication
inconsistencies.

However Percona Cluster 5.6 on Xenial appears to have a bug handling
foreign key constraints that causes them to be violated (LP #1823850).
The result is that the slave node crashes out and has to do a full SST
to recover. The same issue is not present on the master. Thus we leave
the default wsrep_slave_threads=1 on Xenial to avoid this issue for now
particularly since Xenial does not appear to be able to use Group Commit
to optimise the number of sync requests generated by the queries - so
this option does not really improve performance there anyway.

Partial-Bug: #1822903
Change-Id: Ic9cdd6562f30a3e52aa3d26fea53ba7c2bbdc771

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 17:22:40.000000000', 'message': '[POC] Update requirements image

Build requirements image

  $ docker build . --build-arg PROJECT=requirements --tag requirements:latest

Put gerrit projects names into projects.txt
  $ cat << EOF > projects.txt
  packaging/sources/oslo.config
  ...
  EOF

Initialize GERRIT_PREFIX

  $ export GERRIT_PREFIX=ssh://dteselkin@gerrit.mcp.mirantis.com:29418

Fetch project from gerrit and create tarball in /tmp/builddir

  $ ./scripts/prepare_tarball.sh projects.txt /tmp/builddir

Update requirements image

  $./scripts/update_requirements.sh /tmp/builddir requirements:latest

After squashing

  Squashed image size: 59.26 MB

Change-Id: Ia92107491ed9eb8d1f0767cf860ff3bd33907835
'}]
commit_message:
[POC] Update requirements image

Build requirements image

  $ docker build . --build-arg PROJECT=requirements --tag requirements:latest

Put gerrit projects names into projects.txt
  $ cat << EOF > projects.txt
  packaging/sources/oslo.config
  ...
  EOF

Initialize GERRIT_PREFIX

  $ export GERRIT_PREFIX=ssh://dteselkin@gerrit.mcp.mirantis.com:29418

Fetch project from gerrit and create tarball in /tmp/builddir

  $ ./scripts/prepare_tarball.sh projects.txt /tmp/builddir

Update requirements image

  $./scripts/update_requirements.sh /tmp/builddir requirements:latest

After squashing

  Squashed image size: 59.26 MB

Change-Id: Ia92107491ed9eb8d1f0767cf860ff3bd33907835

(cherry picked from commit 2f91f4c58e075a3d756463663ccc9d45032f5262)
'}]
commit_message:
Standardise Workflow messaging and optionally persist messages

This workflow captures the boilerplate that is copied and pasted for Zaqar
messages. It also adds the ability to persist the messages in Swift.

This can be manually tested with:

    $ cat input.json
    {
        "type": "test",
        "queue_name": "tripleo",
        "plan_name": "overcloud",
        "execution": {
            "id": "UUID"
        }
    }
    $ openstack workflow execution create tripleo.messaging.v1.send input.json

Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1757372
Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows
Depends-On: I78b4fc7673a4039ed7ef32b16bb2850411f7fcc6
Change-Id: Ib854689a3e606f18db7354427918fa8043ac28e0
(cherry picked from commit 2f91f4c58e075a3d756463663ccc9d45032f5262)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9c658fcfefacbf3b6722b9648a8765f6c5831265

commit_message:
Changing file owner when upgrading mariadb

When we upgrade mariadb version we mount volumes with data and
config files.

As we use new images we cannot make assumption that UIDs are the same
as on the old image so we set a new files and directories owner.

Two new functions have been added: _restore_directory() and
_restore_home_directory() in class Manager which are responsible to
copy files from the volume to the instance file system and to change
owner and group of the files.

The new function is located in base Manager class as it very likely
that other datastores may use it as well.

Co-Authored-By: Przemysław Godek <p.godek@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: I3c39f51b471081eeabed55070dc91807544a2dda
Story: #2005398
Task: #30391
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Remove now unused task_manager file

We left this in place for the last release to allow nodepool to
stop using it. That transition is done, so remove the unused file.

Change-Id: I0316174e9c9fdf1f418e3728b5a96d46158edb97

[{'created': '2019-04-24 10:23:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pyghmi path

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match
up otherwise devstack fails in CI to clone as cloning
is blocked if not in the projects list... Which it is,
as x/pyghmi.

Change-Id: I87bdf65dd2dac189642d0af6def2d0ed155f3c00
(cherry picked from commit bb8101ca950819a4d55af18d57b53c15ef51c836)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pyghmi path

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match
up otherwise devstack fails in CI to clone as cloning
is blocked if not in the projects list... Which it is,
as x/pyghmi.

Change-Id: I87bdf65dd2dac189642d0af6def2d0ed155f3c00
(cherry picked from commit bb8101ca950819a4d55af18d57b53c15ef51c836)

commit_message:
update git.openstack in _DEFAULT_REQS_DIR

This patch changes the _DEFAULT_REQS_DIR constant to use opendev.org
rather than git.openstack.org in project-requirements-change.py to
address failures such as [1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/09/653009/5/check/requirements-check/
cb0e2ad/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-04-22_15_02_24_958181

Change-Id: I8ecadff2737a40d5dece4c7511ebe54a5efddf64
(cherry picked from commit 674e97a63127b5caa4b9e5f13757603892503d8a)

[{'created': '2019-04-23 12:26:48.000000000', 'message': "Don't run tempest/devstack jobs on nova/test.py only changes

We already skip running the devstack/tempest integration jobs
for changes which only touch nova/tests/* but not the nova/test.py
module itself, so this adds that filter.

Change-Id: I8984e5b68ccb7d327b7ce16c50f19e46e769699a
"}, {'created': '2019-04-25 14:30:09.000000000', 'message': "Don't run tempest/devstack jobs on nova/test.py only changes

module itself, so this adds that filter.

Change-Id: I8984e5b68ccb7d327b7ce16c50f19e46e769699a

commit_message:
Don't run tempest/devstack jobs on nova/test.py only changes

We already skip running the devstack/tempest integration jobs
for changes which only touch nova/tests/* but not the nova/test.py
module itself, so this adds that filter.

Change-Id: I8984e5b68ccb7d327b7ce16c50f19e46e769699a

commit_message:
Add api test for DVR coverting back to centralized

This patch adds a test case for DVR routers which converts a centralized
router to distributed firstly, followed by making a transition back to
centralized. It checks whether the attributes are updated or retained as
expected.

Related-Bug: #1780094
Change-Id: Ida6e75d0215283c15b7a1c0ce0f473169afe8a66

commit_message:
Include nova::availability_zone in scheduler.pp

nova-scheduler uses CONF.default_availabiliy_zone.
However, the required class was not included in scheduler.pp
This patch includes nova::availability_zone class in scheduler.pp.

Signed-off-by: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1824273
Change-Id: Ia94a5d7baf1dd2efc8339475176a1e1c24ad99d0
(cherry picked from commit fd7587d71fd6dd6af6a95104e538d8f04ae9dd5e)

commit_message:
Remove images that are not in use anymore

The tripleoui was disabled and the parameters to build it were removed
in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641743/
This deletes the kolla image creation for that because the missing parameter
was causing problems

commit_message:
Fixup tests for puppet 6

The tests were failing under puppet 6 due to some missing hieradata.
This change pulls in the now seperated selinux and augeas core modules
and adds the missing bootstrap node hieradata.
It also update data structure testing for haproxy testing.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655273/
Change-Id: Id59f3759652d8c1efea46918a9dc5c84fac361e3

messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-03-22 11:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-03-22 12:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2019-04-02 12:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 11:12:32.000000000', 'message': "Improve the network_gateway check on the provisioning network

This patch strengthens the way to get the gateway of the local_subnet in
the undercloud.conf file by getting the local_subnet value first in the
DEFAULT section. And then getting the gateway value from the right
section.

If the local_subnet is not found in the undercloud.conf, then the
default will be 'ctlplane-subnet'.

Change-Id: I618e2fd1ebd1f247264ba835190fb652d0ba0271
Co-Authored-By: Saravanan KR <skramaja@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Improve the network_gateway check on the provisioning network

This patch strengthens the way to get the gateway of the local_subnet in
the undercloud.conf file by getting the local_subnet value first in the
DEFAULT section. And then getting the gateway value from the right
section.

If the local_subnet is not found in the undercloud.conf, then the
default will be 'ctlplane-subnet'.

Change-Id: I618e2fd1ebd1f247264ba835190fb652d0ba0271
Co-Authored-By: Saravanan KR <skramaja@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Podman support to rabbitmq-limits validation

This patch gets the 'container_cli' variable from the inventory in order
to determine if the Overcloud has been deployed with Podman or Docker
before running commands on the rabbitmq container.

Change-Id: Ib6e89232e11080955cf9d29823daa8f5077536b6
Depends-on: I7541bfd244acaf1d00d18b3eef031dbadfe4dd4a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Migrate ansible-lint to pre-commit
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-04-24 09:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 09:46:55.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate ansible-lint to pre-commit

* Kept old specific linter tox targets for backwards compatibility,
  so developer can easily run a single linter if desired.
* Reused tox linters virtualenvs to avoid wasting space
* Moved linter config to their official location which enables
  developer to call them in any way he wants (like his IDE)
* tools/validate-files.py has been updated to check out all the custom
  library files coming from the new validation framework.

Change-Id: I4118200e6862763a0e9dac921dc7c42019224d12
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 82ccd692980e71f387e04c401af81153038cc0b2)
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate ansible-lint to pre-commit

* Kept old specific linter tox targets for backwards compatibility,
  so developer can easily run a single linter if desired.
* Reused tox linters virtualenvs to avoid wasting space
* Moved linter config to their official location which enables
  developer to call them in any way he wants (like his IDE)
* tools/validate-files.py has been updated to check out all the custom
  library files coming from the new validation framework.

Change-Id: I4118200e6862763a0e9dac921dc7c42019224d12
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Podman support to mysql-open-files-limit validation

This patch gets the 'container_cli' variable from the inventory in order
to determine if the Overcloud has been deployed with Podman or Docker
before running commands on the mysql container.

Change-Id: I0f0b69a476335373f36e59e371d8d096ca976aba
Depends-on: I7541bfd244acaf1d00d18b3eef031dbadfe4dd4a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Fix Jinja2's default filter usage
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-04-24 09:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 09:46:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In our case, when we retrieve the variable "container_cli" from the file
'undercloud.conf' or from the inventory, it may not be present and the
default function does not work since the variable "container_cli" is
Undefined or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Id44338a3b6ecea16c3a0bf7eb1e7c0b431e69f95
Implements: blueprint validation-framework
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 23de9d37cd22a5f9b6da6753bee47385dc7d078c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In our case, when we retrieve the variable "container_cli" from the file
'undercloud.conf' or from the inventory, it may not be present and the
default function does not work since the variable "container_cli" is
Undefined or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Id44338a3b6ecea16c3a0bf7eb1e7c0b431e69f95
Implements: blueprint validation-framework
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 23de9d37cd22a5f9b6da6753bee47385dc7d078c)

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Iee8c082b5e4dcb7b035faa56a2182718947ad495

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match

commit_message:
Fix pyghmi path

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match
up otherwise devstack fails in CI to clone as cloning
is blocked if not in the projects list... Which it is,
as x/pyghmi.

Change-Id: I87bdf65dd2dac189642d0af6def2d0ed155f3c00
(cherry picked from commit bb8101ca950819a4d55af18d57b53c15ef51c836)

commit_message:
Remove _ceilometer_check_for_storage check

We can check from the history[0], actually it doesn't matter if
gnocchi or panko is started first., so this check is unnecessary.
Also when i want to migration using native zuulv3, the enabled
plugins is in the alphabetical order, so this will caused can not
install devstack correctly.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/387620
[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/99/651999/3/check/telemetry-integration-test/9066108/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-04-17_07_26_30_988
Change-Id: I5cbd93739f75b8141f8b79ae03bb8b99756b2a38

commit_message:
Drop py35 tests

Drop py35 tests because all the integration testing
has been moved to Bionic.

See the following URL for more details.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

Signed-off-by: zhangyangyang <zhangyangyang@unionpay.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-25 14:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-25 14:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to jsonschema'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-25 15:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-25 19:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-04-25 22:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 14:51:58.000000000', 'message': 'Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I66ad793a52c657564ece35019430557a45edd3bf
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Tony Breeds <tony@bakeyournoodle.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I66ad793a52c657564ece35019430557a45edd3bf
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Tony Breeds <tony@bakeyournoodle.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 08:05:26.000000000', 'message': "Avoid concurrent nova cell_v2 discovery instances

The nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py was moved to run on compute
nodes instead of controllers to allow adding computes without
touching controllers and in case multiple stacks are used to
manage compute nodes. In case the nova-manage command, run by
nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py, gets triggered at the same time
on compute nodes races.

With this change if this is _not_ an additional cell:
* in docker_config step4, on every compute, we start the nova-compute
  container and then start a (detach=false) container to wait for
  it's service to appear in the service list.
* in docker_config step5, on the bootstrap node only, we run the
  discovery.

Change-Id: I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961
Closes-bug: 1824445
Co-authored-by: mschuppert@redhat.com

commit_message:
Avoid concurrent nova cell_v2 discovery instances

The nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py was moved to run on compute
nodes instead of controllers to allow adding computes without
touching controllers and in case multiple stacks are used to
manage compute nodes. In case the nova-manage command, run by
nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py, gets triggered at the same time
on compute nodes races.

With this change if this is _not_ an additional cell:
* in docker_config step4, on every compute, we start the nova-compute
  container and then start a (detach=false) container to wait for
  it's service to appear in the service list.
* in docker_config step5, on the bootstrap node only, we run the
  discovery.

Change-Id: I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961
Closes-bug: 1824445
Co-authored-by: mschuppert@redhat.com
(cherry picked from commit 908e6b9810c02990d66093dc1b47ef0b52d52588)
(cherry picked from commit 8fd58b4b876a56ea846065233b9958303cfa3e73)
(cherry picked from commit cf6ae21fc9619fad2674aca5d3f1332c03b4e825)

subject: disk capacity is less than disk usage
messages:
[{'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-03-08 06:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-04-18 02:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This is the exactly bug we met, could you pls take a review?'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-04-18 03:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thank Shaoman for the patch. Please check out my comment below. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-04-18 03:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I put my -1 here to make sure it's merged without clarifying everything."}, {'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-04-18 05:31:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hi Trinh,

struct virDomainBlockInfo {
    unsigned long long	capacity	logical size in bytes of the image (how much storage the guest will see)
    unsigned long long	allocation	host storage in bytes occupied by the image (such as highest allocated extent if there are no holes, similar to 'du')
    unsigned long long	physical	host physical size in bytes of the image container (last offset, similar to 'ls')
}

This is the definition for virDomainBlockInfo.
So the capacity means the size of the image, while vm mount cd-rom image, libvirt will align by 4K bytes, as a result, physical is bigger than capacity."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-04-22 05:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Shaoman, if that is the case, how about updating the domain.blockInfo function instead?'}, {'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-04-22 05:51:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Trinh,
This API is provided by libvirt, the interface's definition is clear, i think it may be difficult to modify :("}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-04-22 05:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think we need more comments from zhurong and lxkong.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-04-22 06:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am ok with this, and this change we had merged in our openstack production.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-22 22:30:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shaoman, could you please describe more about the issue so we could understand your requirement better, what problem it is bringing to the end user, what's the billing model?"}, {'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-04-23 06:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Lingxian,
The current problem is that in some cases, virtual disk usage is greater than the total, which is puzzling.
Pls have a look at the bug description:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1819107'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-23 07:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi Lingxian,
 > The current problem is that in some cases, virtual disk usage is
 > greater than the total, which is puzzling.
 > Pls have a look at the bug description:
 > https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1819107

I've seen the launchpad bug, but what I was asking is how that affects the end user? Are you using that metric for billing or something else?

You said "capacity means the size of the image, while vm mount cd-rom image, libvirt will align by 4K bytes, as a result, physical is bigger than capacity.", so? How does the eventual sample look like? How are your users affected?

Because we are not using this metric, so I'm confused about what problem you are trying to solve. More information would help.'}, {'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-04-23 08:48:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We used disk capacity and usage to calculate the vm's disk utilization, to assess the health of the vm.
In this case, the disk utilization is bigger than 100%, so the users thought it was an error :("}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-23 09:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-04-23 11:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20100, 'date': '2019-04-23 21:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 06:52:28.000000000', 'message': 'disk capacity is less than disk usage

If the virtual machine mounts cd-rom, libvirt will align by 4K bytes,
causing the disk capacity is less than the disk usage, which does not
seem reasonable.

Maybe we shoulde use the bigger one as disk capacity.

commit_message:
disk capacity is less than disk usage

If the virtual machine mounts cd-rom, libvirt will align by 4K bytes,
causing the disk capacity is less than the disk usage, which does not
seem reasonable.

Maybe we shoulde use the bigger one as disk capacity.

Change-Id: I25808856bce27483da0cb2583ae94e8dc162d647
Closes-Bug: #1819107

Add support to set ovs_nb_connection

When using ovn provider unless set, it would try to
connect to 127.0.0.1.

Change-Id: If8eb685dd21791b65845afd44fb483592b8bcc0c

commit_message:
Enable ansible-role-collect-logs role in TOCI

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652918/ adds ansible-role-collect
-logs as a dependency in TQ.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652919/ skips building the same
during build test packages.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/998

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/652919

Change-Id: I84edc21b7587ecca8c99a693e4ee63c6a4851a9a
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable disablereuse option in Zaqar proxy backend

Modify the Zaqar mod_proxy backend to use use the parameter
disablereuse=On, disabling the ability to reuse connections to the
proxy backend.  This is necessary to prevent reuse of connections by
mod_proxy to the backend Zaqar WebSocket server when the Zaqar
WebSocket server closes the socket on its own, that mod_proxy
occasionally expects to be open.  This creates a new connection with
every request.

Change-Id: Id5f22d8682805566eadd8205a5aa88524ce94b80
Closes-Bug: #1803422
(cherry picked from commit d4c98bd2c615cc3ac6546cea6814b113c352a8d3)

top-level LICENSE file.

subject: Revert "update constraint for oslo.vmware to new release 2.23.2"
messages:
[{'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2019-04-18 04:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2019-04-18 05:28:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For oslo.vmware, the latest tag on stable/pike branch is 2.32.1. We shouldn't update it.

regards,
Damon Li"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-18 06:55:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> For oslo.vmware, the latest tag on stable/pike branch is 2.32.1. We
 > shouldn't update it.
 > 
 > regards,
 > Damon Li

Are you saying there is a problem with https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/pike/oslo.vmware.yaml#L42-L45 ?

It does look like perhaps the release isn't needed but is it actually harmful to include it?

http://logs.openstack.org/88/652888/3/check/releases-tox-list-changes/68e4e12/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-04-16_15_55_12_350925"}, {'account_id': 22078, 'date': '2019-04-18 07:03:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Actually, seems it's not harmful for the upstream CI. It just influences our company's internal CI. We use branch to track the project and use upstream requirements to limit the version. But we found our internal stable/pike don't have 2.32.2 tag. So it will cause failure. So if this can be fixed on community wii be better. Of course, if we think we don't need to do this revert. Feel free to abandon this patch.

regards,
Damon Li"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-18 07:12:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

there is no code change, but I don't see the need to revert

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.vmware/compare/2.23.1...2.23.2"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:04:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Actually, seems it's not harmful for the upstream CI. It just
 > influences our company's internal CI. We use branch to track the
 > project and use upstream requirements to limit the version. But we
 > found our internal stable/pike don't have 2.32.2 tag. So it will
 > cause failure. So if this can be fixed on community wii be better.
 > Of course, if we think we don't need to do this revert. Feel free
 > to abandon this patch.

This needs to be fixed in your CI environment.  You should have a complete clone of the requested repos, and if not and you're broken it implies that your CI isn't actually doing what the community expects a 3rd party CI will do."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibc38740653930222d5f6ed461c9b6967cbb3d795

commit_message:
Use puppet-ceph from stable/mimic

p-o-i in rocky is using luminous and mimic with filebased OSDs which are
not longer supported in puppet-ceph from master (it has been removed in
Ceph Nautilus).

Change-Id: Icba4ffa7f5cc5d9f9175b65f1f0398bb363d8a20

commit_message:
Remove nova_placement and switch scenario001 to use placement

Following on from I5260b4d3478008a76fbe53fdbb716004d11b22df in Stein and
ahead of the removal of the Placement deployment logic from puppet-nova
we can now remove nova_placement from POI. We can also switch the one
remaining job using this class to the puppet-placement based placement
class.

Change-Id: Ia56e403b0f7171ee3583e768404d5f65acd61576
