revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 21:42:15.000000000', 'message': 'Move legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration in-tree

This moves the legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration
job from openstack-zuul-jobs in-tree. Nova is the only project
that runs this job and this allows nova to directly manage it.

The job will still use the same irrelevant-files list and is still
non-voting for the time being and only runs in the check queue.

It has been renamed to "nova-grenade-live-migration".

This change is meant to be backported to rocky, queens and pike
to allow us to drop legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration
from openstack-zuul-jobs where the job is branchless but restricted
to pike+ branches.

A follow up master-only (stein) change will make the job voting
and gate per the plan in the mailing list [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003341.html

Change-Id: Ie9b61775dbb92b10237688eaddaca606c1c73a23

commit_message:
Move legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration in-tree

This moves the legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration
job from openstack-zuul-jobs in-tree. Nova is the only project
that runs this job and this allows nova to directly manage it.

The job will still use the same irrelevant-files list and is still
non-voting for the time being and only runs in the check queue.

It has been renamed to "nova-grenade-live-migration".

This change is meant to be backported to rocky, queens and pike
to allow us to drop legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration
from openstack-zuul-jobs where the job is branchless but restricted
to pike+ branches.

A follow up master-only (stein) change will make the job voting
and gate per the plan in the mailing list [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003341.html

Change-Id: Ie9b61775dbb92b10237688eaddaca606c1c73a23
(cherry picked from commit 53208b0496d78b2f5cd04b1ce0ef5ffcb757e1eb)
(cherry picked from commit 7b9a133bb6374acb0bda32010197641e2f813de6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 19:15:08.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Manila API to httpd and support TLS

manila-api can be deployed in two ways:
- Using the service-provided eventlet based server
- Behind any popular web server as a wsgi process

The project team recommends using httpd over the
in-built eventlet based server to improve
performance, and also handle tls termination.

So, switch the manila-api docker/service to running
httpd, and add necessary configuration options.
Honor the "EnableInternalTLS" option to allow running
manila-api with TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652805/
Change-Id: Ic88a2f08e013a49e3da45a2bfc82c62ba284526a
(cherry picked from commit 1cb6886a21ebf131259ce5884264df32852b7067)
'}, {'created': '2019-04-23 17:22:04.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Manila API to httpd and support TLS

manila-api can be deployed in two ways:
- Using the service-provided eventlet based server
- Behind any popular web server as a wsgi process

The project team recommends using httpd over the

performance, and also handle tls termination.

commit_message:
Switch Manila API to httpd and support TLS

manila-api can be deployed in two ways:
- Using the service-provided eventlet based server
- Behind any popular web server as a wsgi process

The project team recommends using httpd over the
in-built eventlet based server to improve
performance, and also handle tls termination.

So, switch the manila-api docker/service to running
httpd, and add necessary configuration options.
Honor the "EnableInternalTLS" option to allow running
manila-api with TLS.

Depends-On: I47b8820667f7c524a15aa28659626382586d160f
Change-Id: Ic88a2f08e013a49e3da45a2bfc82c62ba284526a
(cherry picked from commit 1cb6886a21ebf131259ce5884264df32852b7067)
(cherry picked from commit 1f054551b985f7e31fa583baf3aa4606e433e92f)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Icfbe3a1f3a972d20795d470ffdd0e142209017e2

commit_message:
Elaborate on the business value of infra admins

Recent threads on the openstack-discuss mailing list [0] suggest
revisiting the idea of formatting the help-wanted list to represent
the value each initiative provides a sponsor. This feedback was given
to the Technical Committee during the Vancouver summit in 2018.

This is an attempt at describing the value improving the OpenStack CI
system has on a business.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/002252.html

Change-Id: Icb0560e74afe4a62193aed573634280be645524a

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
(cherry picked from commit 28a696ea625e4113706e030b773fcf39cb1c49a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
(cherry picked from commit 28a696ea625e4113706e030b773fcf39cb1c49a1)

commit_message:
Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
(cherry picked from commit 28a696ea625e4113706e030b773fcf39cb1c49a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 11:05:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove redis from controller element

Redis has been containerized in Pike already and having the package
in the overcloud-full image makes it problematic during upgrade/update.

This patch should be backported all the way down to Pike.

More info: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1693625

Change-Id: I52fa31cb0556917b6a9d0cdd66085b7197db35ee
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redis from controller element

Redis has been containerized in Pike already and having the package
in the overcloud-full image makes it problematic during upgrade/update.

This patch should be backported all the way down to Pike.

More info: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1693625

Change-Id: I52fa31cb0556917b6a9d0cdd66085b7197db35ee

commit_message:
WIP: Add post-test wrinkle to list deleted servers before archive

The nova-next job runs the post_test_hook.sh script to test
things like archiving and purging deleted records. Before
archiving, we should make sure we can list deleted servers
across all tenants to avoid regressions like bug 1825034.

Change-Id: I220530db8a4328d3604f0415161ad16f990fce7e
Related-Bug: #1825034

commit_message:
Add httpd and tls support to manila-api

Allow specifying TLS options, including
the manila_api_network and include
the generic apache profile to allow setting
options when manila-api is deployed under
apache/mod_wsgi.

Change-Id: I47b8820667f7c524a15aa28659626382586d160f
(cherry picked from commit 8253d883be62d4481d179199bce95018e623481a)
(cherry picked from commit c1f6857aa49f4ac46643fcb5dfba1003c9aeaf2f)

commit_message:
Fix pyghmi path

Pyghmi was moved from openstack namespace to the x
namespace. As such the devstack plugin needs to match
up otherwise devstack fails in CI to clone as cloning
is blocked if not in the projects list... Which it is,
as x/pyghmi.

Change-Id: I87bdf65dd2dac189642d0af6def2d0ed155f3c00
(cherry picked from commit bb8101ca950819a4d55af18d57b53c15ef51c836)

commit_message:
Don't exit on a RUNNING message for deploy workflow

This workflow is being updated to return a RUNNING status when the
workflow starts, so we don't want to assert that SUCCESS is the only
valid outcome anymore.

Related blueprint config-download-workflows

Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1766216
Change-Id: I78b4fc7673a4039ed7ef32b16bb2850411f7fcc6
(cherry picked from commit 624037db017960e6cd6ac18024544c230c078031)

commit_message:
Use get_url instead of aria2c

Aria2c does not follow links and leads to issues with OpenSUSE. Since
the nspawn_host role already uses the `get_url` module successfully,
we should do the same for the lxc_hosts role.

Change-Id: I3e9492ae1cd7380f12b24b1ef45971df35d286b9
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 00:25:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove devstack legacy experimental jobs

I went through all these jobs in git history to (as best I could) find
out where they were put in.  Most have transitioned through various
renames (trusty->xenial, zuulv2/3 update etc) which complicates
things.

Basically none were added within the last year.  With zuulv3, it is
also much easier to just add a change with your updated job and run
that, rather than have it committed to the tree.

Thus with none of these being actively worked on, I think we simply
clear it out and re-evaluate as we add things in-tree.

commit_message:
Remove devstack legacy experimental jobs

I went through all these jobs in git history to (as best I could) find
out where they were put in.  Most have transitioned through various
renames (trusty->xenial, zuulv2/3 update etc) which complicates
things.

Basically none were added within the last year.  With zuulv3, it is
also much easier to just add a change with your updated job and run
that, rather than have it committed to the tree.

Thus with none of these being actively worked on, I think we simply
clear it out and re-evaluate as we add things in-tree.

- tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph:
   Feb 10 2017 : I4ed8442ed0ef2acc1df49c5561bb2361da6b4736

commit_message:
Add job to publish os-client-config vendor files

The vendor.json files are important for other languages than python.
Rather than making a client-side javascript programmer need to install
a python package to extract files from it, directly publish the files to
the os-client-config directory on tarballs.o.o. That way other languages
can fetch them and process them directly as they choose.

Change-Id: I800219e1dc4aa3d6a92a58dd64ab080468633bd6

commit_message:
Fix listener API handling of None/null updates

The current listener API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. Some integer only fields, such as connection-limit,
will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the listener parameters.

Change-Id: I41c9bedd8a3452513af3d409fbacd65ea287f02a
Story: 2005374
Task: 30352
(cherry picked from commit 930a3236bf7fd341b32ba41b2c99cd3ad832d709)

commit_message:
Check for neutron_plugin_ml2_ansible service when including plugin

neutron_plugin_ml2_ansible service is enabled. Check services_names
before including neutron puppet manifest.

Closes-Bug: #1782537
(cherry picked from commit 94f382323f3f70391e2f26baf8e43a0360fc986d)

[{'created': '2019-04-18 09:44:53.000000000', 'message': 'Set gather_facts to false while calling tempest playbook

By default gather_facts is always true and tempest playbook
runs tempest as a root user for creating some directories and
once the tempest run finish, The ansible user dir is changed
to /root and any other playbook called with gather_facts
to false have same /root directory leading to failure in
other playbooks where ansible user dir is used.

Setting gather_facts to false fixes the issue

Change-Id: Ia696afa16a995dfc7c91373f6d162425fe39c7a9
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-22 16:50:18.000000000', 'message': 'Set gather_facts to false while calling tempest playbook

runs tempest as a root user for creating some directories and
once the tempest run finish, The ansible user dir is changed
to /root and any other playbook called with gather_facts
to false have same /root directory leading to failure in
other playbooks where ansible user dir is used.

Change-Id: Ia696afa16a995dfc7c91373f6d162425fe39c7a9
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set gather_facts to false while calling tempest playbook

By default gather_facts is always true and tempest playbook
runs tempest as a root user for creating some directories and
once the tempest run finish, The ansible user dir is changed
to /root and any other playbook called with gather_facts
to false have same /root directory leading to failure in
other playbooks where ansible user dir is used.

Setting gather_facts to false fixes the issue

Change-Id: Ia696afa16a995dfc7c91373f6d162425fe39c7a9
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

Windows and Linux IP implementations have the same interface, IpCommand.
Method calls (set, add, delete, exists) must be the same for both IP

commit_message:
Remove IP proxy methods

Remove IP proxy methods in os_vif.internal.command.ip.__init__.py. Both
Windows and Linux IP implementations have the same interface, IpCommand.
Method calls (set, add, delete, exists) must be the same for both IP
classes, making those proxy calls unnecessary.

Removed a nesting level for internal IP commands. Now those commands are
located in os_vif.internal.ip.

Change-Id: Id8b71172fb06b435cf169a7e55c11233f22fa65b
Closes-Bug: #1817940

commit_message:
Avoid concurrent nova cell_v2 discovery instances

The nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py was moved to run on compute
nodes instead of controllers to allow adding computes without
touching controllers and in case multiple stacks are used to
manage compute nodes. In case the nova-manage command, run by
nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py, gets triggered at the same time
on compute nodes races.

With this change if this is _not_ an additional cell:
* in docker_config step4, on every compute, we start the nova-compute
  container and then start a (detach=false) container to wait for
  it's service to appear in the service list.
* in docker_config step5, on the bootstrap node only, we run the
  discovery.

Change-Id: I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961
Closes-bug: 1824445
Co-authored-by: mschuppert@redhat.com
(cherry picked from commit 908e6b9810c02990d66093dc1b47ef0b52d52588)
(cherry picked from commit 8fd58b4b876a56ea846065233b9958303cfa3e73)

Note that zeroconf dropped Python 2 support in version 0.20, so
we have to cap it for Python 2.

Change-Id: I605b85f75d33c394807cacf4492feaed56a1c61a
Story: #2005393
Task: #30610
'}, {'created': '2019-04-24 16:27:13.000000000', 'message': "Add zeroconf to global-requirements

ZeroConf is a LGPL pure-Python implementation of multicast DNS.
Note that zeroconf dropped Python 2 support in version 0.20, so
we have to cap it for Python 2.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Last commit in March 2019, supports recent Python version, the maintainer
responds to bug reports.

* Is the library good code?

I have a feeling it's quite well written, although more docstrings would
not hurt. The only problematic aspect is missing IPv6 support.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Actually the recent versions ONLY support Python 3.

* Is the library license compatible?

LGPL, seems okay.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Packaged in: Fedora (>= 25), openSUSE and Ubuntu (>= Xenial).
Not packaged in: RHEL7/CentOS7.

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?

I could not find anything. There seems to be only one feature-complete
library for Python.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project?

Ironic would like to use it for automatic discovery of the ironic
and ironic-inspector services by the ironic-python-agent ramdisk

Change-Id: I605b85f75d33c394807cacf4492feaed56a1c61a
Story: #2005393
Task: #30610
"}]
commit_message:
Add zeroconf to global-requirements

ZeroConf is a LGPL pure-Python implementation of multicast DNS.
Note that zeroconf dropped Python 2 support in version 0.20, so
we have to cap it for Python 2.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Last commit in March 2019, supports recent Python version, the maintainer
responds to bug reports.

* Is the library good code?

I have a feeling it's quite well written, although more docstrings would
not hurt. The only problematic aspect is missing IPv6 support.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Actually the recent versions ONLY support Python 3.

* Is the library license compatible?

LGPL, seems okay.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Packaged in: Fedora (>= 25), openSUSE and Ubuntu (>= Xenial).
Not packaged in: RHEL7/CentOS7.

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?

I could not find anything. There seems to be only one feature-complete
library for Python.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project?

Ironic would like to use it for automatic discovery of the ironic
and ironic-inspector services by the ironic-python-agent ramdisk

Change-Id: I605b85f75d33c394807cacf4492feaed56a1c61a
Story: #2005393
Task: #30610

commit_message:
Fix ceph failure rate grafana dashboard

This updates the stats to the latest locations found on
https://graphite.opendev.org and changes the dashboard to show two
panels: one for the nova job and one for the cinder job, since CI
jobs have moved under projects.

Change-Id: I959627e877de09fca847a809a94a4e8be859149c

commit_message:
Remove puppet selinux management

This is managed via ansible now and should no longer be managed via
puppet since we need to have it setup prior to configuring all the
containers items.

Change-Id: Id8d340072ec2941b99b5bc3c6a0511af506ea50b
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653625/

commit_message:
Remove puppet selinux management

We've switched the selinux mode management to ansible as part of the
deploy-steps and it's always included now so the service is not
necessary.

Change-Id: I562053ba6767bd9ab7af3cf06b93906568bec5cd

Add online migrations for untyped volumes

This patch adds the online migration that will change the type
of all untyped volumes with default volume type.

Change-Id: I1d187ef469c483ecf1961c2a911fcce324b1360e

subject: Added status_set and logs to upgrade-charm hook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 935, 'name': 'James Page', 'email': 'james.page@canonical.com', 'username': 'james-page'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 20635, 'name': 'Ryan Beisner', 'email': 'ryanbeisner@gmail.com', 'username': 'ryan-beisner'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25011, 'name': 'Drew Freiberger', 'email': 'drew.freiberger@canonical.com', 'username': 'afreiberger'}, {'_account_id': 30132, 'name': 'David Coronel', 'email': 'david.coronel@canonical.com', 'username': 'davecore'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-03-22 13:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-03-22 13:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Not ready to land, want to discuss first'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-03-22 13:48:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM. Would you mind running giving Drew a ping to see if it's enough to satisfy his bug report?"}, {'account_id': 25011, 'date': '2019-03-22 14:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

While this does set some status messages for upgrade-charm hook, the issue is actually the relations settling after the call to update_all_identity_relation_units where all the related-units run their identity-credentials-relation-changed.

I think we'd need to set some sort of counter in upgrade-charm of how many identity-relations were triggered by the upgrade-charm, then put a status of 'waiting for identity-relation-changed hooks to complete after upgrade - completed X of Y' where Xis how many relation-changed hooks we've received since the upgrade-charm, and Y is number triggered in update_all_identity_relations.

When the Y'th relation-changed hits, the upgrade-charm action's "settle" process can be considered complete and we can reset status to active, Ready'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-03-22 14:47:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Looks like we have more to address per Drew's comments so I'll remove my +1 for now."}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-02 21:25:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I have some new changes that will show as well where we're at in the following loops:

-Firing identity_changed hook for all related services.
-Firing admin_relation_changed hook for all related services.
-Firing identity_credentials_changed hook for all related services.

It won't show a percentage but it will show messages like:

(upgrade-charm) Firing identity_changed hook for glance/0 for identity-service:23.

Would this be enough to consider this bug fixed? I don't recall seeing percentages in other charm upgrade hooks before."}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-04 17:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-04 18:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-04 18:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25011, 'date': '2019-04-09 16:36:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Need to ensure we're setting status back to ready/active at the end of maintenance hooks."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-04-09 16:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Sorry for the late review on this. I don't think we want to be setting update_status messages such as "Firing identity_changed hook for all related services". I think we want to make the messages understandable to a user that we can assume has no interest in understanding how charms work internally.'}, {'account_id': 25011, 'date': '2019-04-09 17:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Drew Freiberger <drew.freiberger@canonical.com>
'}, {'account_id': 25011, 'date': '2019-04-09 17:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Discussed on IRC and agree status_set ready not necessary, as all is functioning properly in testing.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-04-17 13:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Rather than pre-announcing "we are about to fire a hook," I would rather see you make the hook itself describe what it is doing, from within that hook.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-17 16:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-17 20:45:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

My latest patch set #5 (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/645572/5) adds some generic status and log updates to the charm such as:

-Managing packages
-Restarting services
-Updating NRPE configuration
-Disabling unused apache configurations
-Regenerating configuration files
-Migrating the keystone database
-Updating endpoints

The last one (Updating endpoints) takes longer than the rest, but the way to better track this would be via a pending hooks counter that is currently being discussed in a Juju discourse topic (https://discourse.jujucharms.com/t/pending-hooks-counter-and-way-to-introspect-it-in-juju-status/1346).

For anyone wanting to see how this change behaves, I make an asciinema video (https://asciinema.org/a/Bs0G4otlz3Al6j00Qn8j6fywb). Before my change, the whole upgrade-charm would just show "Installing apt packages". Now it cycles through the statuses I listed above.

I'm hoping this patch is enough to close this issue and suggest contributing to the Juju discourse discussion to get better visibility for the pending hooks in Juju.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-04-23 16:20:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Generally OK but I'd like to see more focus on logging on when things are actually being actioned.

Please also review your commit message in the light of:

  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@James: I made your changes except for line 657 about splitting apt_install. I was hoping to keep the adding and removing of packages generic with a "Managing packages" mention.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-04-24 16:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

@David my argument would be that we should only log a message when something is actually happening that might take time - installing packages does take time so we should only log when we have work todo.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-24 17:17:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Then I think some of these changes (such as apt_install, OSConfigRenderer.write_all, service_restart and others) should be done in charmhelpers directly. Would that make sense? Is there a reason why functions in charmhelpers don't use status_set more often?"}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-24 23:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-25 01:13:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(6 comments)

I followed James' comments. I also needed to add unit tests to cover the changes to the apt_install being called conditionally now."}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-04-25 06:28:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi David

This change is looking really good now - I just had one final minor nit I'd like to see resolved and we can get this landed!"}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-25 14:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30132, 'date': '2019-04-25 15:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Fixed the formatting'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-04-25 15:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Added status_set and logs to upgrade-charm hook

When running an upgrade of the keystone charm in a large environment,
the upgrade process can take more than 30 minutes.

Prior to this change, the user would only see 'Installing apt packages'
during most of the process.

This change adds status_set and log messages to the upgrade charm hook
so that end users can see what is the status of the upgrade.

Change-Id: I1eade73fad551310ceec0bb8dcbccb777737faeb
Closes-Bug: #1782004

commit_message:
Update some octavia documentation

This patch improves the Octavia documentation in two ways:
It patch clarifies the format for the enabled_provider_drivers
configuration setting.
It also adds a link to the Octavia release notes to the documentation
home page.

Change-Id: I3f0349f37a5683061de2beff689314469a7dc255

commit_message:
Fix invalid query selector with list_ports

Fixed an exception thrown by neutron_client's list_ports when the
deletion of the VIP security group fails.

Story 2005355
Task 30309

This is a re-write of I7f9dfbd2b3eb1320be755bade2f97b9f0621d409 that
attempts to address the file descriptor leak by ensuring that we
continue to call virtEventRunDefaultImpl for the lifetime of the vbmc
process (see [1]).

This patch adds some methods to support Serial-over-LAN capability.
We'll be able to connect serial console of a domain with "ipmitool sol
activate" command.  SOL capability requires a persistent libvirt
connection, so this patchset adds libvirt_open.get_conn() method and
use it.

[1]: https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2013-September/msg00107.html

commit_message:
[WIP] Add Serial-over-LAN (SOL) support

NB: I have not yet rewritten the unit tests that cover serial-over-lan
support. I'll remove the WIP tag (and this comment) when the tests are
fixed.

This is a re-write of I7f9dfbd2b3eb1320be755bade2f97b9f0621d409 that
attempts to address the file descriptor leak by ensuring that we
continue to call virtEventRunDefaultImpl for the lifetime of the vbmc
process (see [1]).

This patch adds some methods to support Serial-over-LAN capability.
We'll be able to connect serial console of a domain with "ipmitool sol
activate" command.  SOL capability requires a persistent libvirt
connection, so this patchset adds libvirt_open.get_conn() method and
use it.

[1]: https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2013-September/msg00107.html

Change-Id: I2476c620aa9ebea58fda18be822d1961e48a739e

commit_message:
Fix Ceph deployment in apparmor job

This fixes the ceph deployment in the apparmor job as the previous
overrides weren't entirely correct.  This also reorders the
deployment steps in the apparmor job to enforce the sequential
naming scheme used

Change-Id: I161bae649d4ff67307abeadc12b3c7d321af31c7

messages:
[{'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:25:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

2.5.x was Luminous, we did 2.6.x for Mimic, personally I like having 3.x for Nautilus, we might want to check with release team first though to make sure it's approved before we merge changes in our module (this metadata.json change) if they want to enforce using 2.7.x"}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:33:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 09:08:09.000000000', 'message': "Release 3.0.0

First release including support for Ceph Nautilus.

Although this version is maintaining the same configuration parameters,
support for file-based OSDs has been removed so i think it's more
appropiate bump major release.

Change-Id: I0f3918287ba6c58056d5154a2a5f15e274787e5d
"}]
commit_message:
Release 3.0.0

First release including support for Ceph Nautilus.

Although this version is maintaining the same configuration parameters,
support for file-based OSDs has been removed so i think it's more
appropiate bump major release.

Change-Id: I0f3918287ba6c58056d5154a2a5f15e274787e5d

commit_message:
Clarify DCN requirements for provider networks

Explain DHCP constraints and requirements for external, routed and
traditional provider networks. Note for OVN and config-drive options as
well.

Co-authored-by: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Icc1633238ac5786dc346d17b248b51428a9d498c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Constraint pyroute2 to 0.5.3
messages:
[{'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-15 16:08:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think we'll need more to go on than that it breaks something.

Please link to a bug report and if creating a cap like this please create a requirements bug so we track uncapping it once the issue with pyroute2 is fixed."}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I think we'll need more to go on than that it breaks something.
 > 
 > Please link to a bug report and if creating a cap like this please
 > create a requirements bug so we track uncapping it once the issue
 > with pyroute2 is fixed.

Sure, I wasn't sure about the required process here. Is it okay now? There's no comment from pyroute2 maintainer yet, but it normally takes quite a long time for him to answer."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-16 18:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-18 13:31:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We discussed this in the weekly meeting, and correct me if I'm wrong Matthew, but it would be better to only set upper-constraints. Adding the cap in global-requirements can cause more work later if/when we want to uncap things."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-18 13:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

To clarify, better to blacklist specific versions that to set an overall cap.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

you are correct, the reason is that a cap will filter out to all the projects, once we want the cap removed the projects will need to make releases before we can update the version of pyroute2, which can be troublesome.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-19 11:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-19 11:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Sean, Matthew: Do you mean something like this?'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-19 11:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I meant it for the patchset #4 of course.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-19 11:48:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think that's right. Even though it looks odd, we could set u-c to the 0.5.5 version so if issues with it are ever resolved we can just remove the blacklisting from g-r, but this looks OK."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

yep, this looks fine'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-24 08:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-24 14:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck

Is it normal it is so flaky?'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-04-25 07:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Constraint pyroute2 to 0.5.3

Seems like latest releases - 0.5.4 and 0.5.5 create issues for
Kuryr-Kubernetes in nested mode (note that we don't run that mode in the
gate due to technical reasons). This is being tracked by issue 599 [1]
in pyroute2 bug tracker.

This commit constraints pyroute2 to 0.5.3.

[1] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/599

Story: 2005460
Task: 30530
Related-Bug: 1824846
Change-Id: I37e7b9de70a008edfbe5e745718b2dae3968722a

Maybe backport the changed in master to the other stable branches as well if it's broken there so it's not only fixed in master and queens."}, {'account_id': 5792, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-18 15:21:05.000000000', 'message': 'Set MAC address for VF via netlink message to PF

SR-IOV binding driver uses pyroute2 library to set MAC addresses
to VFs. This is internally implemented via ioctl(SIOCSIFHWADDR)
giving it the name of that device. This is equal to calling
'ip link set dev $VFDEV address $MAC'. However, there is another
way to set MAC address for VF. It works via netlink RTM_SETLINK
message to the PF. This is equal to calling
'ip link set dev $PFDEV vf $VFID mac $MAC'.

How it works:
* ioctl(SIOCSIFHWADDR) asks the VF driver to set the MAC
  --> VF driver asks PF to set MAC for it
  --> PF sets the MAC for VF.
* RTM_SETLINK message asks the PF to set MAC for VF
  --> PF sets the MAC for VF.

In case of setting directly via PF, PF additionally sets an
"administratively changed MAC" flag for that VF in the PF's
driver, and from that point on (until the PF's driver is
reloaded) that VF's MAC address can't be changed using the
method #1.

It's a security feature designed to forbid MAC changing by the
guest OS/app inside the container.

Above leads to the issue where SR-IOV CNI is not able to set MAC
address for VF if its MAC was previously administratively set at
least once (by hands or other software):

  ioctl SIOCSIFHWADDR: Cannot assign requested address

  kernel: igb 0000:05:00.0:
    VF 0 attempted to override administratively set MAC address
    Reload the VF driver to resume operations

After that CNI fails the whole transaction, i.e. fails to change
the interface name as well and subsequently fails the binding.

Netlink PF method to change MAC addresses should be used always.
This will additionally forbid the MAC changing from the inside
of container.

Change-Id: Ic47672e4ce645d9d37b520b6a412a44ae61036e1
Closes-Bug: 1825383
Co-authored-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Ilya Maximets <i.maximets@samsung.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-24 12:28:06.000000000', 'message': 'Set MAC address for VF via netlink message to PF

  kernel: igb 0000:05:00.0:
    VF 0 attempted to override administratively set MAC address
    Reload the VF driver to resume operations

After that CNI fails the whole transaction, i.e. fails to change

commit_message:
Set MAC address for VF via netlink message to PF

SR-IOV binding driver uses pyroute2 library to set MAC addresses
to VFs. This is internally implemented via ioctl(SIOCSIFHWADDR)
giving it the name of that device. This is equal to calling
'ip link set dev $VFDEV address $MAC'. However, there is another
way to set MAC address for VF. It works via netlink RTM_SETLINK
message to the PF. This is equal to calling
'ip link set dev $PFDEV vf $VFID mac $MAC'.

How it works:
* ioctl(SIOCSIFHWADDR) asks the VF driver to set the MAC
  --> VF driver asks PF to set MAC for it
  --> PF sets the MAC for VF.
* RTM_SETLINK message asks the PF to set MAC for VF
  --> PF sets the MAC for VF.

In case of setting directly via PF, PF additionally sets an
"administratively changed MAC" flag for that VF in the PF's
driver, and from that point on (until the PF's driver is
reloaded) that VF's MAC address can't be changed using the
method #1.

It's a security feature designed to forbid MAC changing by the
guest OS/app inside the container.

Above leads to the issue where SR-IOV CNI is not able to set MAC
address for VF if its MAC was previously administratively set at
least once (by hands or other software):

  ioctl SIOCSIFHWADDR: Cannot assign requested address

  kernel: igb 0000:05:00.0:
    VF 0 attempted to override administratively set MAC address
    Reload the VF driver to resume operations

After that CNI fails the whole transaction, i.e. fails to change
the interface name as well and subsequently fails the binding.

Netlink PF method to change MAC addresses should be used always.
This will additionally forbid the MAC changing from the inside
of container.

Change-Id: Ic47672e4ce645d9d37b520b6a412a44ae61036e1
Closes-Bug: 1825383
Co-authored-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Ilya Maximets <i.maximets@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 07:55:48.000000000', 'message': "Use OS_CACERT for zaqar's websocket connection

The CA certificatge was hardcoded. This was not the right thing to do,
since we do have the ability to provide our own cert for TripleO.

python-openstackclient already has a way for us to know what certificate
was used. This is provided via the OS_CACERT environment variable (or
the --os-cacert command line argument). So we use this instead.

Change-Id: Ib7b3860378fce2cda7f80c1ad8b8dd14a4b22581
Closes-Bug: #1817634
(cherry picked from commit 24ac1f137c7bf03b4e6310d65344374695498d89)
"}]
commit_message:
Use OS_CACERT for zaqar's websocket connection

The CA certificatge was hardcoded. This was not the right thing to do,
since we do have the ability to provide our own cert for TripleO.

python-openstackclient already has a way for us to know what certificate
was used. This is provided via the OS_CACERT environment variable (or
the --os-cacert command line argument). So we use this instead.

Change-Id: Ib7b3860378fce2cda7f80c1ad8b8dd14a4b22581
Closes-Bug: #1817634
(cherry picked from commit 24ac1f137c7bf03b4e6310d65344374695498d89)

commit_message:
Refactor functional base test classes

The functional base test class should be implemented under os-vif.
Other projects will inherit from this project to implement functional
test cases.

Change-Id: Ib5873687032bfb55d1847d4948f6e9679cf6d31e
Closes-Bug: #1817938

commit_message:
Move RDO repos to stein in stable/stein branch

RDO/CentOS jobs are still using master repos to test with stable/stein
branch.

Also, this review is setting puppet-ceph branch to stable/mimic as
current master has been modified to work with nautilus which is not
compatible with previous versions.

Change-Id: I6371bc0f2bb47058ba7b15d22099017fa29fc49b

commit_message:
Document policy of never removing traits

It has been asked at least twice in recent weeks (the first time by
me) why unused traits can't be removed from os-traits:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-04-18.log.html#t2019-04-18T17:59:58
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-04-25.log.html#t2019-04-25T10:48:18

so let's explicitly document this policy to prevent future generations
getting confused, or worse, attempting to remove traits.

Change-Id: I4028c25ff5fc0adeca6ee62b0db11d8bbf909f28

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-04-25 07:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-25 07:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-04-25 08:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 07:03:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove the uca option for ceph_pkg_source

Having 'uca' as a valid value for ceph_pkg_source means that we
have to maintain the UCA parameters in another repo other than
the openstack_hosts role, and it has not been maintained well.
This is evidenced by the fact that the current value is set to
'pike', which is very old.

To reduce this maintenance burden, we simply remove this option.

Change-Id: I78bfd1585804c0261645a8e008a7acef66b5795a
(cherry picked from commit 706f3b62458f852b05f017c061f7e3e1ccf3eff7)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the uca option for ceph_pkg_source

Having 'uca' as a valid value for ceph_pkg_source means that we
have to maintain the UCA parameters in another repo other than
the openstack_hosts role, and it has not been maintained well.
This is evidenced by the fact that the current value is set to
'pike', which is very old.

To reduce this maintenance burden, we simply remove this option.

Change-Id: I78bfd1585804c0261645a8e008a7acef66b5795a
(cherry picked from commit 706f3b62458f852b05f017c061f7e3e1ccf3eff7)

commit_message:
Support for the baremetal introspection service

This change adds support for the baremetal introspection
(aka ironic-inspector) API. The initial patch includes starting,
stopping introspection, retrieving introspection statuses and
introspection data.

Change-Id: I4b8448316b1b6f6777ed0044374175ed794937f1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-04-25 08:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

Thats where we place in the txt with the info to the containers dir'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-25 08:59:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Martin, I think that Bogdan has a valid question: why do we need 2-3 different placement folders? What makes the already existing one not enough? Why do we need a new one?

Can't we update the place that produce content in /var/log/placement to use /var/log/containers/placement ?

Having less folders with identical names is always better, to avoid confusions."}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:09:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Martin, I think that Bogdan has a valid question: why do we need
 > 2-3 different placement folders? What makes the already existing
 > one not enough? Why do we need a new one?
 > 
 > Can't we update the place that produce content in /var/log/placement
 > to use /var/log/containers/placement ?
 > 
 > Having less folders with identical names is always better, to avoid
 > confusions.

We don't put logs in /var/log/placement. It is just like all the other
services to have a /var/log/<service> directory containing the readme.txt
with the info where to find the container logs.

# find /var/log -name readme.txt
/var/log/openvswitch/readme.txt
/var/log/aodh/readme.txt
/var/log/ceilometer/readme.txt
/var/log/cinder/readme.txt
/var/log/glance/readme.txt
/var/log/gnocchi/readme.txt
/var/log/haproxy/readme.txt
/var/log/heat/readme.txt
/var/log/horizon/readme.txt
/var/log/keystone/readme.txt
/var/log/memcached/readme.txt
/var/log/mariadb/readme.txt
/var/log/neutron/readme.txt
/var/log/nova/readme.txt
/var/log/panko/readme.txt
/var/log/rabbitmq/readme.txt
/var/log/redis/readme.txt
/var/log/swift/readme.txt

I guess the subject of the commit message is confusing."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the explanation Martin, I still don't understand how the original change managed to pass the gate between this and the various other issues..."}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:54:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Thanks for the explanation Martin, I still don't understand how the
 > original change managed to pass the gate between this and the
 > various other issues...

A Yatin mentioned above, we have seen it, but the ansible task has ignore_errors set to true. thats why it was "hidden"'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:42:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If you see more ignore_errors please try to obliterate them, in 9/10 cases they are bugs/bad coding practice.

That's why I ended writing https://medium.com/@sbarnea/why-ansible-ignore-errors-is-evil-500fb6e81229 article about one year ago."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-04-25 12:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Create /var/log/placement on host for file logging

created.

I'm away the whole of next week; will be back on 01-April (no, not a joke ;-)) and start chugging away at the feedback, if there is any in the meantime."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2019-03-22 19:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-05 16:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2019-04-05 22:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-08 09:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-08 10:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I have nothing against this. It seems pretty self contained.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-09 13:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(11 comments)

There's a couple of nits in there that should be cleaned up but I, like gibi, think this is sane and self-contained enough to warrant inclusion"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-09 14:48:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(13 comments)

Well, this certainly says we can do a thing, but it's not entirely clear to me what specific issues in nova this solves if we do it."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-09 14:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-09 15:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

i think there are enough nits that this needs a respin but
i like the general direction.
two its inline.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-09 16:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[I answered your question on IRC, but writing it here for persistence.]

 > (13 comments)
 > 
 > Well, this certainly says we can do a thing, but it's not entirely
 > clear to me what specific issues in nova this solves if we do it.

The following is one of the issues that will be solved.  I'm going to add a variant of the below blurb in the spec.  I stole a bit of your phrasing :-):


Today operators have to be careful about how they configure the libvirt driver with regard to `cpu_model` and `cpu_model_extra_flags`, because the wrong combination can lead to failures to launch a guest.  I.e. operators have to manually validate the CPU flags they're supplying to Nova are actually supported on the given compute node.  With this change, the libvirt driver will automatically validate if a given combination of CPU model + flags can work on a given compute host—e.g. Nova will now be able to answer: "Is this combination of IvyBridge + 'pcid' & 'pdpe1gb' supported by KVM, QEMU and libvirt on the host?").  So the operator can now set the CPU model plus flags, and let Nova handle the rest.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-22 16:47:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

> lead to failures to launch a guest.

Meaning Nova will blithely put together the XML etc., but then the actual instance won't... spawn? Boot? Work?

> With this change, the libvirt driver will automatically validate if a given combination of CPU model + flags can work on a given compute host

...and if they can't, nova will fail the spawn (earlier)?

So the point of this is to make instance creation fail earlier - and presumably log a better reason - if there's a bad combination of host + CPU models + flags?

I'll echo Matt's comments (I think) by saying that this is very much not clear in the spec. (I suspect you're so entrenched in it that it's obvious to you.)"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-24 05:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Actually, you add the validation of cpu_model+extra spec at another spec https://review.opendev.org/#/c/642030/6/specs/train/approved/cpu-model-selection.rst@69 :)

I guess that why people confuse at here.

For this spec, actually, it is very easy, we just use the new libvirt API instead of the old API, the new API can catch more invalid cpu_model+extra flags cases than the old one :)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-24 05:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

And actually ok with this spec :)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-24 14:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > lead to failures to launch a guest.
 > 
 > Meaning Nova will blithely put together the XML etc., but then the
 > actual instance won't... spawn? Boot? Work?
 
Exactly, Nova will put together the XML, but it will fail to spawn.

 > > With this change, the libvirt driver will automatically validate
 > if a given combination of CPU model + flags can work on a given
 > compute host
 > 
 > ...and if they can't, nova will fail the spawn (earlier)?

Yes, my current thinking is that we should fail to spawn.

 > So the point of this is to make instance creation fail earlier -
 > and presumably log a better reason - if there's a bad combination
 > of host + CPU models + flags?

Yeah, that is one of the points.  A related point is that: when I say we will get "better-informed guest CPU", it means, the newer API, baselineHypervisorCPU(), when calculating baseline CPU it will *filter out* CPU features that are not supported by QEMU on the host. 

 > I'll echo Matt's comments (I think) by saying that this is very
 > much not clear in the spec. (I suspect you're so entrenched in it
 > that it's obvious to you.)

I will add some clarifying text to this shortly.  Thanks for the reviews, everyone.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-25 13:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-25 13:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-25 13:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-25 13:51:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the updates, kashyap. This lgtm.

You had several +2s before, and the recent changes were just adding detail, so I'll fast approve this in the next couple of hours."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-25 13:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-04-25 14:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 17:33:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add "CPU selection with hypervisor consideration" spec

Make Nova's guest CPU selection approach more effective and reliable by
introducing two new QEMU- and libvirt-based CPU configuration APIs:
baselineHypervisorCPU() and compareHypervisorCPU().  These new APIs are
more "hypervisor-literate" in comparison to the existing libvirt APIs
that Nova uses.  As in, the new APIs take into account what the "host
hypervisor" (meaning: KVM, QEMU, and what libvirt knows about the host)
is capable of.

Taking advantage of these newer APIs will allow Nova to make more
well-informed decisions when determining CPU models that are compatible
across different hosts.

Blueprint: cpu-selection-with-hypervisor-consideration

Change-Id: Ie1a90b906a9bed0295a9324956a755d577c42379
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie1a90b906a9bed0295a9324956a755d577c42379
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add "CPU selection with hypervisor consideration" spec

Make Nova's guest CPU selection approach more effective and reliable by
introducing two new QEMU- and libvirt-based CPU configuration APIs:
baselineHypervisorCPU() and compareHypervisorCPU().  These new APIs are
more "hypervisor-literate" compared to the existing libvirt APIs that
Nova uses.  As in, the new APIs take into account what the "host
hypervisor" (meaning: KVM, QEMU, and what libvirt knows about the host)
is capable of.

Taking advantage of these newer APIs will allow Nova to make more
well-informed decisions when determining CPU models that are compatible
across different hosts.

Blueprint: cpu-selection-with-hypervisor-consideration

Change-Id: Ie1a90b906a9bed0295a9324956a755d577c42379
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 21:57:33.000000000', 'message': 'Trigger port status DOWN on VIF replug

Now with the merge of push notifications, processing a port update
no longer automatically implies a transition from ACTIVE to BUILD
to ACTIVE again.

This resulted in a bug where Nova would unplug and replug an interface
quickly during rebuild and it would never get a vif-plugged event.
Nothing in the data model was actually being updated that resulted in
the status being set to DOWN or BUILD and the port would return before
the agent would process it as a removed port to mark it as DOWN.

This fixes the bug by making the agent force the port to DOWN whenever
it loses its VLAN. Watching for the VLAN loss was already introduced
to detect these fast unplug/plug events before so this just adds the
status update.

Closes-Bug: #1694371
Change-Id: Ice24eea2534fd6f3b103ec014218a65a45492b1f
(cherry picked from commit 0d7952400be3e60973a30fae76a82ec5c8259ffc)
'}]
commit_message:
Trigger port status DOWN on VIF replug

Now with the merge of push notifications, processing a port update
no longer automatically implies a transition from ACTIVE to BUILD
to ACTIVE again.

This resulted in a bug where Nova would unplug and replug an interface
quickly during rebuild and it would never get a vif-plugged event.
Nothing in the data model was actually being updated that resulted in
the status being set to DOWN or BUILD and the port would return before
the agent would process it as a removed port to mark it as DOWN.

This fixes the bug by making the agent force the port to DOWN whenever
it loses its VLAN. Watching for the VLAN loss was already introduced
to detect these fast unplug/plug events before so this just adds the
status update.

Closes-Bug: #1694371
Change-Id: Ice24eea2534fd6f3b103ec014218a65a45492b1f
(cherry picked from commit 0d7952400be3e60973a30fae76a82ec5c8259ffc)

commit_message:
Deduplicate next-page URL's query params

This avoid HTTP 414 caused by endless addition of query params onto
the next-page's URL that already contains them in case where the number
of pages is high.

Change-Id: I4f89e8e4837bb7c08c841e50070541038a2d2cc2

commit_message:
Skip boostrap-ansible on upgrades if already run

Skips bootstrap-ansible on a rerun if it has already run
previously.

Moves the working directory creation to it's own function
so that the lock directory is created earlier.

Change-Id: I156e0143991c79cc2f664a98b6cd22353c01b55d

Thanks, Raphael! LGTM.

One thing I was wondering was whether the default should be the DB's field width, i.e. the sql TEXT width of 65k (or sth close to that) rather than the 1k you set now. I checked the maintenance_reason/last_error in our prod DB and found one entry with 1500k ... (which is admittedly coming from our driver, but the code is being upstreamed atm)."}, {'account_id': 15064, 'date': '2019-04-12 08:36:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Hey Arne. Yep that's right, the max text field length for mysql (by default) is 65k, but actually there are also other params that could interfer here like max_allowed_packet (and may be others that I'm not aware of). The most frequent issue observed was the 'Data too long' one, but I also saw some 'connection closed'/'broken pipe' errors for some big transactions before 65k. That's why the default was chosen far from 65k, but we could also change it if you think it may be good to increase it (5k ?)"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:51:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I see ... I'm fine with 1k. If you don't get an idea about where the problem is in the first 1k chars, I'm not sure more text will help :)

Thanks for the patch!"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-12 14:49:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'd prefer increasing this value, to be honest. At least to 4k. More importantly, let's mention the new option in the release notes."}, {'account_id': 15064, 'date': '2019-04-12 19:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15064, 'date': '2019-04-12 19:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Truncate node text fields when too long

Pushing too long messages in the node last_error and maintenance reason can
cause node.save() failures, leaving the node in a transient state, with no
conductor actually handling it anymore.

Change-Id: Id4db377781f83cf4d97564ced9622d5a8a8c67af
Story: #2005377
Task: #30359

[{'created': '2019-04-25 13:16:43.000000000', 'message': "Switch from 1.1.1.1 to 1.0.0.1

CloudFlare's public recursive DNS resolvers are available at
multiple anycast addresses. For some reason 1.1.1.1 is unreachable
from parts of OVH's BHS1 region, but 1.0.0.1 seems to be
consistently reachable. Swap this for improved reliability.

Change-Id: I9a264282ea6c8239883d252f52e004deebca3edc
"}]
commit_message:
Switch from 1.1.1.1 to 1.0.0.1

CloudFlare's public recursive DNS resolvers are available at
multiple anycast addresses. For some reason 1.1.1.1 is unreachable
from parts of OVH's BHS1 region, but 1.0.0.1 seems to be
consistently reachable. Swap this for improved reliability.

Change-Id: I9a264282ea6c8239883d252f52e004deebca3edc

commit_message:
Remove IP proxy methods

Remove IP proxy methods in os_vif.internal.command.ip.__init__.py. Both
Windows and Linux IP implementations have the same interface, IpCommand.
Method calls (set, add, delete, exists) must be the same for both IP
classes, making those proxy calls unnecessary.

Removed a nesting level for internal IP commands. Now those commands are
located in os_vif.internal.ip.

Closes-Bug: #1817940
Change-Id: I74e8e005bcd9c34efe6aeb169cae7f233f0e700b

commit_message:
Fix Swift Rate Calculation

* To find the oldest and newest quantities
  for calculating rate, Spark Data Frame
  is converted to a Spark RDD, which makes it
  easy to do a group by and sort. The syntax to pull
  the value from a map column type in an
  RDD is rdd.map_column['key'] which
  is different from dataframe.map_column.key
  which was causing  'dict' object has no attribute
  exception

* Renamed first_attempt_at_spark_test.py to
  test_first_attempt_at_spark, because all the tests
  in that file were not being run.

* Changed the pre transform and transform specs
  which were being used by test_first_attempt_at_spark
  to newer 'dimensions#field_name that was introduced
  in rocky release.

Story: 2005449
Task: 30501

Change-Id: I6adeee54fe261c535372b8f5f3580e7d3261259b
(cherry picked from commit 963f77481811fb91476fa07a49e825d89af02fea)

commit_message:
Disable strict variables for unit tests

So rspec-puppet 2.4+ has strict variables enabled
which causes test failures. The problem is that the puppet modules
have never worked with strict_variables = true due to backwards
compatibility & import ordering.  Since this has not been true,
lets disable it in the unit testing for now. Perhaps some day
we will be able to turn this back to true.  This should allow us to lift
the 2.3.x cap that we added as part of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/618854/.

Change-Id: Idbf837e87072c829c94e0356b8536088cf98c3bb

subject: Fix Swift Rate Calculation
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 17:34:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix Swift Rate Calculation

* To find the oldest and newest quantities
  for calculating rate, Spark Data Frame
  is converted to a Spark RDD, which makes it
  easy to do a group by and sort. The syntax to pull
  the value from a map column type in an
  RDD is rdd.map_column['key'] which
  is different from dataframe.map_column.key
  which was causing  'dict' object has no attribute
  exception

* Renamed first_attempt_at_spark_test.py to
  test_first_attempt_at_spark, because all the tests
  in that file were not being run.

* Changed the pre transform and transform specs
  which were being used by test_first_attempt_at_spark
  to newer 'dimensions#field_name that was introduced
  in rocky release.

Story: 2005449
Task: 30501

Change-Id: I6adeee54fe261c535372b8f5f3580e7d3261259b
(cherry picked from commit 963f77481811fb91476fa07a49e825d89af02fea)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift Rate Calculation

* To find the oldest and newest quantities
  for calculating rate, Spark Data Frame
  is converted to a Spark RDD, which makes it
  easy to do a group by and sort. The syntax to pull
  the value from a map column type in an
  RDD is rdd.map_column['key'] which
  is different from dataframe.map_column.key
  which was causing  'dict' object has no attribute
  exception

* Renamed first_attempt_at_spark_test.py to
  test_first_attempt_at_spark, because all the tests
  in that file were not being run.

* Changed the pre transform and transform specs
  which were being used by test_first_attempt_at_spark
  to newer 'dimensions#field_name that was introduced
  in rocky release.

Story: 2005449
Task: 30501

Change-Id: I6adeee54fe261c535372b8f5f3580e7d3261259b
(cherry picked from commit 963f77481811fb91476fa07a49e825d89af02fea)

commit_message:
libvirt: disconnect volume when encryption fails

The compute node has left the attachment information after the
encryption fails. This patch fixes this by ensuring the volume is
disconnected when an exception occurs.

Change-Id: I9d652f182d83a2557ff6ed0b21c69a735c3f9840
Closes-Bug: #1812945
(cherry picked from commit 79bcb4e21b7909f3e989d4fbcf68ac268680b865)
(cherry picked from commit d773e3b1469a76f129d2f7a4edab68d007f3f928)

commit_message:
Fix regression in glance client call

In [0] the way parameters are passed to the glance client was changed.
Sadly one required argument was dropped during this, we need to insert
it again in order to fix e.g. rbd backend usage.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/614351

Change-Id: I5a4cfb3c9b8125eca4f6c9561d3023537e606a93
Closes-Bug: 1803717
(cherry picked from commit fd540e2135c26d8c297695a3fa73d993655f0ad8)

commit_message:
Check master/backup router status in DVR functional tests

When two routers are created at the same time, we can't assume the
status of each one. Instead of this, the status of each router is
first checked and then compared to the other router status.

Change-Id: If20a3a414986ea29fbfd50616761c14e5b249b2c
Closes-Bug: #1819160
(cherry picked from commit 8f35331c918f83381951fc4367f43b2805d556ef)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 03:01:27.000000000', 'message': 'Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I95b5520ca0e8da7b2a7663a272bc740b8c809592
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669
'}]
commit_message:
Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I95b5520ca0e8da7b2a7663a272bc740b8c809592
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669

commit_message:
Evaluating ansible_check_mode as a boolean

Evaluating ansible_check_mode as a bare variable is deprecated in
Ansible 2.8 and its support will be removed in 2.12.

Change-Id: I4d566bf8b7b3085d693fe94b53384e667f81b092
(cherry picked from commit 7e73fac11a84a7167dadfb7cfd01ee66461f1502)

commit_message:
Use oslo_cache.memcache_pool as cache backend

oslo_cache.memcache_pool uses the same dogpile.cache but adds support of
pools, which may mark one memcached backend as dead, when instance
is down. os_nova uses oslo_cache.memcache_pool for some time,
so this patch adds some unification for our roles as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/653409/

commit_message:
docker-rm: check if rpm dependency is actually installed

If the deployment wasn't deployed under Docker, python2-docker package
is missing. Therefore, during the upgrade we don't want to try to remove
the containers under Docker, since they don't exist anyway.

python2-docker is needed by Ansible to remove the containers, so let's
make sure the package is installed, which is the case when the
deployment was under Docker.
If the rpm doesn't exist, we'll skip the tasks and don't try to remove
the containers.

The main case where docker-rm is useful is when upgrading on centos7
from rocky to stein, since we clear containers running in Docker during
the upgrade, so they run on Podman.

In reality, the future platform won't have Docker installed, so this
role will become useless and we'll probably deprecate it.

Closes-Bug: #1824301
Change-Id: Ic5036ffa756775e3806e18b09e034af2290bfb56
(cherry picked from commit e368e15226b18d6f75b0ffaca424ce4cb574b2a4)

commit_message:
Fix log rotation in monasca agent

Observed AttributeError in forwarder and collector logs due to
missing import of logging module handlers.

Added missing import and removed module level import.

Task:15058
Story: 2001941
Change-Id: I62b03bb550c8b01ce9ea5bb4ba49a2ac00763d68
(cherry picked from commit 82200d94011031fc0176dc5369541b23f494c444)

messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

note that currently (in master branch) Heat is the only project using
releases.openstack.org as a source for upper constraints

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=releases.openstack.org&i=nope&files=%5Etox.ini&repos='}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The original intention to point to the redirect rule on releases.openstack.org is that anyone working on this branch will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when the requirements repository branches.

So we should change it to:

https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/train'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:01:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

fair enough'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 10:24:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fetch constraints from opendev.org

this is a follow up to change I90cf7584830afccdd0028b0ed7e5061e67430815
that reverted (wrong) upper constraints link to releases.openstack.org

But that link is in fact doing 2 redirects now
(releases.openstack.org->git.openstack.org->opendev.org).
Use properly formatted direct link to opendev.org instead.

Change-Id: Ib57e816fa9512dc37a3b6c565a1f7618d5660e2e
'}]
commit_message:
Fetch constraints from opendev.org

this is a follow up to change I90cf7584830afccdd0028b0ed7e5061e67430815
that reverted (wrong) upper constraints link to releases.openstack.org

But that link is in fact doing 2 redirects now
(releases.openstack.org->git.openstack.org->opendev.org).
Use properly formatted direct link to opendev.org instead.

Change-Id: Ib57e816fa9512dc37a3b6c565a1f7618d5660e2e

commit_message:
Delete namespace with network policy on it

Create network policy on non-default namespace and make sure that
SG was created for that policy
Remove the namespace and make sure the network policy and SG were
deleted

Change-Id: I9d417cf81ac21cb786a1b498f257fe01850388c5

[{'created': '2019-04-23 10:34:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix download upper constraints

We use the url from tox.ini to download the upper constraints and
recently that has changed to a redirect and curl doesn't
correctly follows redirects by default but stops at the first
page.
Adding -L option to curl command makes curl follows the redirect
until the final location is found and should allow the correct
file to be downloaded.

Change-Id: I25c724ffe189d414643c910be0ef61c550f802b7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix download upper constraints

We use the url from tox.ini to download the upper constraints and
recently that has changed to a redirect and curl doesn't
correctly follows redirects by default but stops at the first
page.
Adding -L option to curl command makes curl follows the redirect
until the final location is found and should allow the correct
file to be downloaded.

Change-Id: I25c724ffe189d414643c910be0ef61c550f802b7

[{'created': '2019-04-24 13:31:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix {min|max}_version in ironic Adapter setup

Change If625411f40be0ba642baeb02950f568f43673655 introduced
nova.utils.get_ksa_adapter, which accepts min_version and max_version
kwargs to be passed through to the ksa Adapter constructor. These are
supposed to represent minimum and maximum *major* API versions,
min_version was erroneously set to *microversions* when setting up the
Adapter for ironicclient. This commit changes it to a major version.
(Microversion negotiation is done within ironicclient itself.)

Also, this bug went latent for several releases because a) it only seems
to be triggered when region_name is given in the conf; but also b)
ironicclient has code to discover a reasonable endpoint if passed None.
So this change also adds a warning log if we try and fail to discover
the endpoint via ksa.

Change-Id: I34a3f8d4a496217eb01790e2d124111625bf5f85
Closes-Bug: #1825583
(cherry picked from commit 13278be9f265e237fc68ee60acfacaa1df68522e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix {min|max}_version in ironic Adapter setup

Change If625411f40be0ba642baeb02950f568f43673655 introduced
nova.utils.get_ksa_adapter, which accepts min_version and max_version
kwargs to be passed through to the ksa Adapter constructor. These are
supposed to represent minimum and maximum *major* API versions,
min_version was erroneously set to *microversions* when setting up the
Adapter for ironicclient. This commit changes it to a major version.
(Microversion negotiation is done within ironicclient itself.)

Also, this bug went latent for several releases because a) it only seems
to be triggered when region_name is given in the conf; but also b)
ironicclient has code to discover a reasonable endpoint if passed None.
So this change also adds a warning log if we try and fail to discover
the endpoint via ksa.

Change-Id: I34a3f8d4a496217eb01790e2d124111625bf5f85
Closes-Bug: #1825583
(cherry picked from commit 13278be9f265e237fc68ee60acfacaa1df68522e)

commit_message:
The volume groups return message add project ID

The returned data does not contain tenant information,
and it is impossible to know which tenant the volume group belongs to.
This patch add project ID in return data

Change-Id: Ie6119c8720985b699f688b840e81539c7542c9e6

commit_message:
Remove put_allocations() from report client

As the last user of this call was changed in
Ide343c1c922dac576b1944827dc24caefab59b74 not to depend on
put_allocations() any more. So this patch removes this function and the
related unit tests. Some functional tests also adapted.

Change-Id: I6c18e6bfece391532662ce67d95525673d64787c

commit_message:
Increase retries numbers of grafana check task

20 seconds may be too short to wait for grafana ready, Let's keep the
check task 60 seconds.

backport: rocky

Change-Id: Ib219ad215d1ef2147ba3591f8c398feb4f3c8888
Closes-Bug: #1821285

the config of auth_url/username/password... will not work.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/plugin-options.html#using-plugins-via-config-file

commit_message:
Fix auth config in "Install Cyborg from Source"

We should add the auth_type under the keystone_auth section. Otherwise,
the config of auth_url/username/password... will not work.

See more in keystoneauth official doc [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/plugin-options.html#using-plugins-via-config-file

commit_message:
Fix the project name in setup.cfg

During cookiecutter migration, the project name
ansible-role-tripleo-collect-logs was there but the project name
is ansible-role-collect-logs which is causing issue saying
setup.py not found while doing pip install.

Change-Id: I202fedbbb45153af8a0e2441398aaf928162ab65
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Give some HA router case specific resources

1. give each HA failover case an independent vrrp_id
2. give each HA port an independent IP address, so the
interface IPs for router HA ports will be:
    169.254.192.100 and 169.254.192.101
    169.254.192.102 and 169.254.192.103
    169.254.192.104 and 169.254.192.105
    169.254.192.106 and 169.254.192.107
VIP of each case will be:
    169.254.0.10/24
    169.254.0.11/24
    169.254.0.12/24
    169.254.0.13/24
    169.254.0.14/24

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I1216d96af40449ec16a852cc1f6c4f15c85f4546
(cherry picked from commit c69a87405af6b632a3edd9c6fe5ee63a5bc07eb1)

commit_message:
Check master/backup router status in DVR functional tests

When two routers are created at the same time, we can't assume the
status of each one. Instead of this, the status of each router is
first checked and then compared to the other router status.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Change-Id: If20a3a414986ea29fbfd50616761c14e5b249b2c
Closes-Bug: #1819160
(cherry picked from commit 8f35331c918f83381951fc4367f43b2805d556ef)
(cherry picked from commit 8ba589994236862834aa1bf35907b84ffa3fda9b)

commit_message:
Set HA failover bridges veth pair devices UP

The test bridge veth pair devices is not up which cause the
VRRP advertisement packet can not pass to each HA port. Then
multiple master router is up. This patch just sets the veth
pair devices up.

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I0e0d0311d73bce83d3c7341e7a0167917818b1ff
(cherry picked from commit 8cc480bd01d21f05296c77db231b706a7dc5b475)
