messages: [{'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-04-24 05:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2019-04-24 07:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-04-25 07:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 05:35:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix build without git being installed in build env

Without git being installed, the old (deprecated) pbr integration fails
with

  Warning, treated as error:
  Cannot find git top directory, assuming "."

we did not notice that in the SUSE CI because there was a local hack,
but an actual openSUSE build fails. by switching to sphinx-build
we can avoid this problem, which is more consistent with the rest
of the spec files anyway.

Change-Id: I2dced5316da56e580dddc78d9706ab7562c9257b
(cherry picked from commit 4f65b56dcd1caeca41b8e228d1b0b4ef3cbdce47)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix build without git being installed in build env

Without git being installed, the old (deprecated) pbr integration fails
with

  Warning, treated as error:
  Cannot find git top directory, assuming "."

we did not notice that in the SUSE CI because there was a local hack,
but an actual openSUSE build fails. by switching to sphinx-build
we can avoid this problem, which is more consistent with the rest
of the spec files anyway.

Change-Id: I2dced5316da56e580dddc78d9706ab7562c9257b
(cherry picked from commit 4f65b56dcd1caeca41b8e228d1b0b4ef3cbdce47)

commit_message:
separate launching audit scheduler

Now there are only one scheduler for launching audit task and
executing audit jobs. We have found an exception where the scheduler
stops for some reason when executing audit.
In order to keep launching audit task normal, we need to split into
two schedulers.

Change-Id: I45dccaf062290cfc7d7fcfc27fe11d6f87f38afa

[{'created': '2019-04-19 08:55:27.000000000', 'message': "Remove the uca option for ceph_pkg_source

Having 'uca' as a valid value for ceph_pkg_source means that we
have to maintain the UCA parameters in another repo other than
the openstack_hosts role, and it has not been maintained well.
This is evidenced by the fact that the current value is set to
'pike', which is very old.

To reduce this maintenance burden, we simply remove this option.

Change-Id: I78bfd1585804c0261645a8e008a7acef66b5795a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the uca option for ceph_pkg_source

Having 'uca' as a valid value for ceph_pkg_source means that we
have to maintain the UCA parameters in another repo other than
the openstack_hosts role, and it has not been maintained well.
This is evidenced by the fact that the current value is set to
'pike', which is very old.

To reduce this maintenance burden, we simply remove this option.

Change-Id: I78bfd1585804c0261645a8e008a7acef66b5795a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-23 13:08:05.000000000', 'message': "Avoid concurrent nova cell_v2 discovery instances

The nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py was moved to run on compute
nodes instead of controllers to allow adding computes without
touching controllers and in case multiple stacks are used to
manage compute nodes. In case the nova-manage command, run by
nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py, gets triggered at the same time
on compute nodes races.

With this change if this is _not_ an additional cell:
* in docker_config step4, on every compute, we start the nova-compute
  container and then start a (detach=false) container to wait for
  it's service to appear in the service list.
* in docker_config step5, on the bootstrap node only, we run the
  discovery.

Change-Id: I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961
Closes-bug: 1824445
Co-authored-by: mschuppert@redhat.com
(cherry picked from commit 908e6b9810c02990d66093dc1b47ef0b52d52588)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid concurrent nova cell_v2 discovery instances

The nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py was moved to run on compute
nodes instead of controllers to allow adding computes without
touching controllers and in case multiple stacks are used to
manage compute nodes. In case the nova-manage command, run by
nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py, gets triggered at the same time
on compute nodes races.

With this change if this is _not_ an additional cell:
* in docker_config step4, on every compute, we start the nova-compute
  container and then start a (detach=false) container to wait for
  it's service to appear in the service list.
* in docker_config step5, on the bootstrap node only, we run the
  discovery.

Change-Id: I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961
Closes-bug: 1824445
Co-authored-by: mschuppert@redhat.com
(cherry picked from commit 908e6b9810c02990d66093dc1b47ef0b52d52588)

commit_message:
Fix attribute mismatch in router provider update

The transition of a router from distributed to centralized may
mistakenley get its 'ha' attribute updated at the same time. The
side-effect is that the router may become HA enabled unexpectedly.

This patch fixed the mismatched attribute in _update_router_provider
method which addressed the issue cited above.

Closes-Bug: #1780094
Change-Id: Ib00de137692979229d1b7ba033ecff04e9cc9db0
(cherry picked from commit 886e24155358afe7ad167ba1602d3939d68c3d5f)

commit_message:
Remove _ceilometer_check_for_storage check

We can check from the history[0], actually it doesn't matter if
gnocchi or panko is started first., so this check is unnecessary.
Also when i want to migration using native zuulv3, the enabled
plugins is in the alphabetical order, so this will caused can not
install devstack correctly.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/387620
[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/99/651999/3/check/telemetry-integration-test/9066108/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-04-17_07_26_30_988
Change-Id: I5cbd93739f75b8141f8b79ae03bb8b99756b2a38

commit_message:
Upgrade openstacksdk version to solve connections leak

This patch upgrade openstacksdk version equal or greater than 0.27.0.

Change-Id: I66a81ce710394de3403702d0dec8e8ce804268bc
Closes-Bug: #1809691

If we need to clone patches from Openstack CI either in CI

commit_message:
Make git.openstack.org as default git server

If we need to clone patches from Openstack CI either in CI
(rarely) or in local developers usage, we have to use git
server git.openstack.org only for patches downloading.

Close-Bug: #1676853
Change-Id: Ifc3dbeb052cdeb73993736a919a09aea8e024ca8

[{'created': '2019-04-23 14:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression in glance client call

In [0] the way parameters are passed to the glance client was changed.
Sadly one required argument was dropped during this, we need to insert
it again in order to fix e.g. rbd backend usage.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/614351

Change-Id: I5a4cfb3c9b8125eca4f6c9561d3023537e606a93
Closes-Bug: 1803717
(cherry picked from commit fd540e2135c26d8c297695a3fa73d993655f0ad8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression in glance client call

In [0] the way parameters are passed to the glance client was changed.
Sadly one required argument was dropped during this, we need to insert
it again in order to fix e.g. rbd backend usage.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/614351

Change-Id: I5a4cfb3c9b8125eca4f6c9561d3023537e606a93
Closes-Bug: 1803717
(cherry picked from commit fd540e2135c26d8c297695a3fa73d993655f0ad8)

commit_message:
Replace Ceph Mimic by Nautilus in CentOS

Ceph Nautilus has now a stable release 14.2.0 and it's being packaged
in CentOS Storage SIG. Mimic release was not LTS so let's replace it
by Nautilus where possible.

Since nautilus, the supported store backend is LVM which can use a block
device directly (not loopback) or a LVM logical volume for OSDs.

This patch is creating a LVM structure to create the OSD used to
validate Ceph and switching scenario004 to use nautilus instead of
mimic, so we will keep testing both Luminous and Nautilus, LTS releases.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650263/
Change-Id: I81441237a8b7cf651fa6926b2eb3c4ed0d42bb58

commit_message:
Update airship-divingbell check job

This updates the airship-divingbell repository defined in the
single node check job to use the correct repository namespace.

This also updates the divingbell check job to use the standard
osh-infra-gate-runner playbook as well as the minikube based
kubernetes deployment

Change-Id: Iff53279b3e09058deb323d092955cbf87230b5e5

[{'created': '2019-04-24 12:47:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix keepalived VIP monitoring script

Currently keepalived monitors VIPs by running some shell commands
that target HAProxy. The generated shell command is invalid, which
makes keepalived log errors.

Tue Apr 16 11:55:57 2019:    Command = '/usr/bin/test' '-S' '/var/lib/haproxy/stats' '&&' 'echo' 'show'
Tue Apr 16 11:55:57 2019: Script `haproxy` now returning 2
Tue Apr 16 11:55:57 2019: VRRP_Script(haproxy) failed (exited with status 2)

Fix quoting and invoke /bin/sh explicitely to fix the error:

Thu Apr 18 13:16:35 2019:    Command = '/usr/bin/sh' '-c' 'test -S /var/lib/haproxy/stats && echo show info | socat /var/lib/haproxy/stats stdio'

Closes-Bug: #1825366
(cherry picked from commit f5d6110a79ca11f00728429660428ab99f5292d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix keepalived VIP monitoring script

Currently keepalived monitors VIPs by running some shell commands
that target HAProxy. The generated shell command is invalid, which
makes keepalived log errors.

Tue Apr 16 11:55:57 2019:    Command = '/usr/bin/test' '-S' '/var/lib/haproxy/stats' '&&' 'echo' 'show'
Tue Apr 16 11:55:57 2019: Script `haproxy` now returning 2
Tue Apr 16 11:55:57 2019: VRRP_Script(haproxy) failed (exited with status 2)

Fix quoting and invoke /bin/sh explicitely to fix the error:

Thu Apr 18 13:16:35 2019:    Command = '/usr/bin/sh' '-c' 'test -S /var/lib/haproxy/stats && echo show info | socat /var/lib/haproxy/stats stdio'
Thu Apr 18 13:16:35 2019: VRRP_Script(haproxy) succeeded

Change-Id: I5a757f88963270e77c8ec411cd292a30f89c6bc0
Closes-Bug: #1825366
(cherry picked from commit f5d6110a79ca11f00728429660428ab99f5292d1)

Currently keepalived monitors VIPs by running some shell commands
that target HAProxy. The generated shell command is invalid, which
makes keepalived log errors.

Thu Apr 18 13:16:35 2019:    Command = '/usr/bin/sh' '-c' 'test -S /var/lib/haproxy/stats && echo show info | socat /var/lib/haproxy/stats stdio'

check. Jobs are still in check only and non-voting.

- centos7 buildah branchful stein job

These jobs will be gating and voting as soon as they get stable
running in check queue. When this happens, we can replace/remove
old docker container build jobs for master and stein. For now,
we'll keep duplicate jobs for docker/buildah.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/815

commit_message:
Create new container build jobs for stein

Define branchful jobs for stein with both docker/buildah.

docker cli:
  - tripleo-build-containers-centos-7
  - tripleo-build-containers-centos-7-stein (NEW*)
  - tripleo-build-containers-centos-7-rocky

buildah cli:
  - tripleo-build-containers-centos-7-buildah
  - tripleo-build-containers-centos-7-buildah-stein (NEW*)

Both Docker and Buildah jobs are voting and gating, however,
buildah ones are not stable for pushing to registry, see
Bug #1824388. None of these jobs push to registry in check/gate.

Will keep duplicate jobs for docker/buildah cli until we
completely switch to buildah.

Related-Bug: #1824388
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/815

Change-Id: I20d1546d18f44c8c2da9614cbbd5c15b7d8f88d1

subject: Uncap jsonschema

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 02:59:54.000000000', 'message': 'Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I2d2ad4bbc7c54d3ff33deaa49553fc001f218316
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669
'}, {'created': '2019-04-05 14:23:41.000000000', 'message': 'Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I2d2ad4bbc7c54d3ff33deaa49553fc001f218316
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669

commit_message:
Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I2d2ad4bbc7c54d3ff33deaa49553fc001f218316
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669

commit_message:
Enable os_tempest in baremetal-full-overcloud-validate playbook

In order to run os_tempest on FS039, os_tempest playbook i.e.
tempest.yaml needs to be called during baremetal full
overcloud validate step. This patch enables the same.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/795

Change-Id: I287e7eb8c94c6af3d243235e25fd8aa060214b13
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Added ansible-role-collect-logs role to TQE requires

In order to complete the integration of new
ansible-role-collect-logs role, we need to add it a TQE requires
so that it will be installed by tripleo-quickstart.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/998

Change-Id: Ica6c6468bcc6ed827b11a95a37f1c858e0d6a96d
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

'}]
commit_message:
nova_metadata firewall_rules missmatch

nova_metadata firewall_rules was wrongly referenced to
tripleo::nova_placement::firewall_rules . Since placement got
extracted to its own service nova_metadata rules get not applied.

Closes-bug: #1826178

Change-Id: Ifc69495682ac4f2939414a59408742953663049d

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: If5096aefbcface1392c39a7f41618579ad07326c

[{'created': '2019-04-17 11:05:57.000000000', 'message': 'Set HA failover bridges veth pair devices UP

The test bridge veth pair devices is not up which cause the
VRRP advertisement packet can not pass to each HA port. Then
multiple master router is up. This patch just sets the veth
pair devices up.

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I0e0d0311d73bce83d3c7341e7a0167917818b1ff
(cherry picked from commit 8cc480bd01d21f05296c77db231b706a7dc5b475)
'}]
commit_message:
Set HA failover bridges veth pair devices UP

The test bridge veth pair devices is not up which cause the
VRRP advertisement packet can not pass to each HA port. Then
multiple master router is up. This patch just sets the veth
pair devices up.

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I0e0d0311d73bce83d3c7341e7a0167917818b1ff
(cherry picked from commit 8cc480bd01d21f05296c77db231b706a7dc5b475)

[{'created': '2019-04-15 16:26:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set IfNotPresent imagePullPolicy for created pods

Even though kuryr-tempest-plugin DevStack plugin is building the
kuryr/demo container to make it available locally, it seems that we
create pods with the default imagePullPolicy, which is Always. This
means that image is downloaded anyway.

To work this around we can just set imagePullPolicy to IfNotPresent and
this commit does so.

Please note that an alternative could be to use a specified image tag
instead of :latest, but IfNotPresent still seems to make sense in tests.

Change-Id: I1fa559da39a44d802edb6f46d71cb8d20b66fd7a
Closes-Bug: 1799239

commit_message:
Set IfNotPresent imagePullPolicy for created pods

Even though kuryr-tempest-plugin DevStack plugin is building the
kuryr/demo container to make it available locally, it seems that we
create pods with the default imagePullPolicy, which is Always. This
means that image is downloaded anyway.

To work this around we can just set imagePullPolicy to IfNotPresent and
this commit does so.

Please note that an alternative could be to use a specified image tag
instead of :latest, but IfNotPresent still seems to make sense in tests.

Change-Id: I1fa559da39a44d802edb6f46d71cb8d20b66fd7a
Closes-Bug: 1799239

While running smoke tests using
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652060/ in os_tempest jobs, the
tempest volume and compute api tests are failing with
Invalid image identifier or unable to access requested image error.
Adding glance_api_version in cinder.conf fixes the issue.

commit_message:
Set glance_api_version=2 in cinder.conf

While running smoke tests using
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652060/ in os_tempest jobs, the
tempest volume and compute api tests are failing with
Invalid image identifier or unable to access requested image error.
Adding glance_api_version in cinder.conf fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I8ae1599b96ead1361ee82960fd5fb66c259ea0ff
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
When looping call fails do not log the exception trace

This makes debugging terribly difficult when there are random
legitimate errors, for example a file is not found.

Change-Id: Iec76b95a70552de8e27683c0ea388b55b519db9f

[{'created': '2019-02-07 22:32:43.000000000', 'message': 'Correct notification driver

The notification driver setup was resulting in the driver and connection string
on the same line. This is caused by the case statement and how jinja formats
the template when a case statement is present. This change modifies how the
driver string is created using a ternary, which will eliminate the case
statement and render the value of the diver correctly.

commit_message:
Correct notification driver

The notification driver setup was resulting in the driver and connection string
on the same line. This is caused by the case statement and how jinja formats
the template when a case statement is present. This change modifies how the
driver string is created using a ternary, which will eliminate the case
statement and render the value of the diver correctly.

Change-Id: I9614af2d8a7e908327d2c8ee64f75070dbccfb08
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Remove the AIO scenario & add new scenarios to maintain coverage

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-28 08:11:31.000000000', 'message': "Reduce the AIO scenario & add new scenarios to maintain coverage

The AIO test scenario has grown over time to cover a lot more today that
it when it was first conceived. This change reduces the general AIO test
so that it's essentially testing the compute-starter kit as dictated by
the TC [0], and adds addition scenarios so that we retain test coverage
for all of our supported services.

All new jobs have been added as NOT voting, and only to the Xenial jobs.
If this is something we wish to apply to SUSE and CentOS we can with a
future PR. Once the jobs have stabilized and assuming folks are happy
with this direction we can promote the jobs to voting.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/starter-kit_compute.html
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Id1940e3ec14cd1c4b5daff88fdf566f1a8c7feef

Depends-On: Ia8697285baa714ab345381b28574a222c5881954
Change-Id: Id1940e3ec14cd1c4b5daff88fdf566f1a8c7feef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-10-30 15:38:08.000000000', 'message': "Remove the AIO scenario & add new scenarios to maintain coverage

The AIO test scenario has grown over time to cover a lot more today that
when it was first conceived. This change removes the general AIO test
in favor of using more focused scenarios which will provide a
faster loop from the gate, maintains the existing test coverage, expands
test coverage for moduler service delivery, is set to run on all of our
supported OS's, and will reduce transient failures related to long
running jobs.

While the AIO tests have been removed from the gate we're keeping the
AIO scenario which is the default UX when `gate-check-commit.sh` script
is executed and we're ensuring that the longer running AIO is still run
as a periodic job.

All new jobs have been added as NOT voting with the exception for
compute, cinder, and swift on Xenial which ensures we're not missing
any existing test coverage. Once the jobs have stabilized across the 
OS's we support and folks are happy with this direction we can promote
more jobs to voting.

A couple of changes have been made to the haproxy services list to
correct assumptions we've had due to always testing the full
stack on every deployment.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/starter-kit_compute.html

"}, {'created': '2017-10-30 19:16:44.000000000', 'message': "Remove the AIO scenario & add new scenarios to maintain coverage

The AIO test scenario has grown over time to cover a lot more today that
when it was first conceived. This change removes the general AIO test
in favor of using more focused scenarios which will provide a
faster loop from the gate, maintains the existing test coverage, expands
test coverage for moduler service delivery, is set to run on all of our
supported OS's, and will reduce transient failures related to long
running jobs.

While the AIO tests have been removed from the gate we're keeping the
AIO scenario which is the default UX when `gate-check-commit.sh` script
is executed and we're ensuring that the longer running AIO is still run
as a periodic job.

All new jobs have been added as NOT voting with the exception for
compute, cinder, and swift on Xenial which ensures we're not missing
any existing test coverage. Once the jobs have stabilized across the 
OS's we support and folks are happy with this direction we can promote
more jobs to voting.

A couple of changes have been made to the haproxy services list to
correct assumptions we've had due to always testing the full
stack on every deployment.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/starter-kit_compute.html
Depends-On: I21318d7c737c2415ef760b46176c3f9b372bb634
Change-Id: Id1940e3ec14cd1c4b5daff88fdf566f1a8c7feef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove the AIO scenario & add new scenarios to maintain coverage

The AIO test scenario has grown over time to cover a lot more today that
when it was first conceived. This change removes the general AIO test
in favor of using more focused scenarios which will provide a
faster loop from the gate, maintains the existing test coverage, expands
test coverage for moduler service delivery, is set to run on all of our
supported OS's, and will reduce transient failures related to long
running jobs.

While the AIO tests have been removed from the gate we're keeping the
AIO scenario which is the default UX when `gate-check-commit.sh` script
is executed and we're ensuring that the longer running AIO is still run
as a periodic job.

All new jobs have been added as NOT voting with the exception for
compute, cinder, and swift on Xenial which ensures we're not missing
any existing test coverage. Once the jobs have stabilized across the
OS's we support and folks are happy with this direction we can promote
more jobs to voting.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/starter-kit_compute.html
Change-Id: Id1940e3ec14cd1c4b5daff88fdf566f1a8c7feef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7704b6d9620eb3bd4c98a57f82268422fcb1852a
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

subject: Fix listener API handling of None/null updates
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-04-04 21:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-04-07 08:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Michael,

So with this patch, any value=None update to a listener attr will reset it to its default value. Code-wise, this is going precisely that so LGTM.

My question is about the expected outcome when we get "value=None".
Shouldn't we keep the existing attribute value? So in a PUT request that consists of some valid values - we apply them, but for 'None' we hold the current values (and maybe log a warning)?

I'm open for discussion here (so my vote might change).'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2019-04-14 08:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The current listener API does not properly handle clearing/reseting

will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

commit_message:
Fix listener API handling of None/null updates

The current listener API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. Some integer only fields, such as connection-limit,
will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the listener parameters.

Change-Id: I41c9bedd8a3452513af3d409fbacd65ea287f02a
Story: 2005374
Task: 30352

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib48e9c7ada53a899a1197fdaf92b90188d758832
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: Id990f08682decc3f88c5dbb9c322213ee39f38b7

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I44ded4ea9f301c353e2532f1364d54665b92c5c3
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Test using tempest plugin

Instead of a basic API port check, use zaqar's tempest plugin for
functional testing. A test playbook to install mongodb has been
included.

A default policy.json has been added, along with config_template
overrides for both it and logging.conf.

Closes-Bug: 1666235
Change-Id: I820226495128e07179132d75a47a76fc57791b26

commit_message:
Set external web URL for Prometheus services

This change ensures that URLs returned from these services reference
the HAProxy endpoint, rather than the host on which the service is
running.

Closes-Bug: #1825150
Change-Id: I7f966ff749ea37620f1bde7019a598cb9505fa45

commit_message:
Update the config_template plugin from upstream

While the config_template plugin has been moved into a stand alone repo
the plugins repo is still in use and should be updated with the latest
plugin. This change pulls in the latest diff.

Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

subject: Re-approve AMD SEV support for Train
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2394, 'name': 'Adam Spiers', 'email': 'aspiers@suse.com', 'username': 'adam.spiers'}, {'_account_id': 2697, 'name': 'Jim Fehlig', 'email': 'jfehlig@suse.com', 'username': 'jfehlig'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24938, 'name': 'Bryan Stephenson', 'email': 'bryan.stephenson@suse.com', 'username': 'bryans'}, {'_account_id': 30138, 'name': 'Brijesh Singh', 'email': 'brijesh.singh@amd.com'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-03-08 12:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-03-08 12:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-03-08 12:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2019-03-14 17:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-03-15 00:50:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks like there's a serious concern about the spec in its current form, with regard to hard limiting memory per-VM. I think this spec should be adjusted to address this issue, before we re-approve it, and rather not re-approve it as-is because it was Previously-approved."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:27:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Based on Dan's concerns here, and a chat with Erik Skultetty from 
libvirt this spec needs some more redesign.  

Another factor (other than security) to consider with the limit
calculation is scaling: people could potentially add hundreds of VirtIO devices to the guest, where a hard-coded memory value added on top of the current memory allocation might simply not be enough for the intended workload, thus causing the VMs fail to boot because of the hard limit."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2019-03-15 11:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-03-15 11:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A related quick note:

Intel has an equivalent upcoming, called: "MKTME" (Multikey Total Memory Encryption).  Kernel enablement of Intel's MKTME is in-progress (https://lwn.net/Articles/758313/ -- MKTME enabling).  And they have expressed a desire to integrate MKTME into libvirt (refer: https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2019-February/msg01730.html)

So we (Nova) might want to bear that in mind, too.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-03-19 13:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

given the concerns raised i do think we should modify the spec but i dont think the issues are hard to adress.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2019-03-19 15:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30138, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Currently, any memory region backed by the QEMU (including RAM, ROM,
UEFI pflash and video RAM etc) are pinned for the SEV cases.

The SEV memory encryption engine uses a tweak such that two identical
plaintext pages at the different location will have a different ciphertext. So swapping or moving ciphertext of two pages will not result in the plaintext being swapped. By pinning (i.e increasing reference count at kernel layer) we ensure that page will never get moved or migrated.

The hugepage will guarantee that pages are resident in the memory but  it does not guarantee that pages will never move (aka migrate). The pages are still free to migrate within the hugepages pool and it will be problem for the SEV guest.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-03-19 18:54:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-03-19 19:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30138, 'date': '2019-03-19 19:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The mlock() syscall will ensure that pages are kept locked but the page migration is still possible. See "migrating mlocked pages" section in kernel-doc below

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/vm/unevictable-lru.txt

In typical page migration the pgtable tables are updated and contents are copied from the source to the destination. In case of SEV, the contents copy phase will not provide correct results because the pages contains the encrypted data. Recent SEV firmware spec provides commands which can be used to copy the encrypted contents but it's not implemented yet. In addition, we also need to work with older firmware and kernel combination.

The <memtune> parameter itself does not pin the memory, all it does is raises the rlimit for the process. As part of SEV guest flow QEMU issues a special KVM_MEMORY_ENCRYPT_{REG,UNREG}_REGION ioctls see https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/virtual/kvm/api.txt

These icotls takes a memory region and pins it using the kernel APIs which ensures that those ranges are excluded from the page move rcu list. While pinning the pages, KVM checks the rlimit to ensure that it  does not blindly act upon the request. If rlimit is not large enough then pining the pages through this ioctl will fail.

The pages pinned using these icotl will never migrate whereas the pages pinned using the mlock() *can* migrate as you see in kernel-doc.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-03-19 19:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ok so the requriement is that 
KVM_MEMORY_ENCRYPT_{REG,UNREG}_REGION ioctls are issued by qemu and that the rlimit is large enough that does ioctls dont fail.

if we set the locked memory backing element rlimit is set to infinite and qemu can still use the ioctls to ensure the pages cannot migrate and we will ensure that the pages cant be swapped so that seam like the correc thing to do.

setting 

<memoryBacking>
    <locked/>
</memoryBacking>

is not the same as calling mlock it  also remvoes the rlimit on locked pages.

that said unless we also use hugepages we will have acounting issues in placement and potential OOM issue as we will not be properly tracking free pages per numa node when spawning sev instance and risk exausing idiviual numa nodes.

so really i think we need something more like this.

<memoryBacking>
    <hugepages>
      <page size="2" unit="M" nodeset="1"/>
    </hugepages>
    <nosharepages/>
    <locked/>
    <source type="file"/>
    <access mode="shared"/>
    <allocation mode="immediate"/>
  </memoryBacking>

if we dont use hugepages we will need to for the compute node ram allcoation ration to 1 for sev enabled hosts as the 
KVM_MEMORY_ENCRYPT_{REG,UNREG}_REGION ioctls will lock the memroy region in ram preventing oversubsrption via swapping.
that in trun will break the placment accounting if ram allocation ration is not 1 and since we would not be useign an explict memory backing we sould not use the resouce track to ensure we did not exaust a numa node as a result the sev guest would be at risk of being killed by the kerenl OOM process. using hugepages + locked will fix most of the issues and the KVM_MEMORY_ENCRYPT_{REG,UNREG}_REGION ioctls will solve the page migration issue allowing sev to work.'}, {'account_id': 30138, 'date': '2019-03-19 20:22:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am fairly new to libvirt, you all are well versed into libvirt and various xml tags. I don't have any strong preference for which tag to use.

I wanted to highlight that just by using the hugepages is not sufficient, we need to ensure that pages does not move and for that  we need to set rlimit to either infinite or compute it otherwise SEV icots will fail.

The <memtune> seems to do the trick for raising the rlimit. If there is something better then I am all for using that.

If 

<memoryBacking>
    <locked/>
</memoryBacking>

sets the rlimit to unlimited then that should work fine.

If you are manually setting the rlimit then make sure you cover for more than the guest RAM size. Because as part of SEV flow we pin guest RAM, ROM, VRAM and UEFI Pflash regions."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-03-20 13:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13478, 'date': '2019-04-08 13:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13478, 'date': '2019-04-08 13:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24938, 'date': '2019-04-08 23:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'd like a small change to remove "SEV_ES" from the policy because it is not ready.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-15 14:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-15 14:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-15 14:43:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-16 20:48:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

The addition of the SEV_CONTEXT resource class makes all the trait work redundant. It sucks that you've already done a bunch of the implementation, but is there some good reason we shouldn't just do that?

If there is a good reason, please mention it in Alternatives."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-16 20:49:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

By the way, this spec feels really heavy on implementation details to me. Maybe that's intentional."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-16 23:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-16 23:34:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)

> The addition of the SEV_CONTEXT resource class makes all the trait work redundant.

Urgh, you are probably right :-/

> It sucks that you've already done a bunch of the implementation,

Well, actually not too much work has gone *directly* into the provision and consumption of HW_CPU_AMD_SEV specifically.  True, it's been merged into os-traits, but that was a small patch.  Much more effort has gone into the SEV detection and the configuration of an SEV guest.

The cost of change of direction might not be too big:

- Introduce the SEV_CONTEXT resource class

- Remove the HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait, unless there's still a use for it we somehow missed.  Having a trait which noone used in the code for a single release is regrettable, but far from disastrous.

- Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638680/7/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py@640 to update the provider tree with the inventory for this class rather than using a new capability

... and that's pretty much it.  The main sunk cost would be all the effort I put into implementing capabilities-to-traits conversion, but even if SEV ended up not using that, I would certainly expect it to be useful elsewhere based on what I've been told.  Indeed I think I already saw Matt start some work which consumes it.  We could just agree that you cunningly hoodwinked me into doing it, and I'll consider a beer in Denver fair payment ;-)

> but is there some good reason we shouldn't just do that?
> If there is a good reason, please mention it in Alternatives.

There probably isn't.  I can adapt the spec, although I'd prefer to hear what others think first.  Sean, Matt, Jay, Chris etc. - any opinions?

> By the way, this spec feels really heavy on implementation details to me. Maybe that's intentional.

Well it started much lighter, but it's attracted a heavy amount of feedback, and each time concerns are addressed it gets a little bigger ;-)  Even getting it approved for Stein took 16 patch sets, and that was before the new wave of realisations which have arrived for this new round in Train.  If you think stuff can be taken out then suggestions are extremely welcome, but everything which has gone in so far seemed necessary in order to address concerns which were raised, so I suspect taking stuff out could cause some regressions..."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2019-04-17 08:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2019-04-17 11:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-17 17:03:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

> Remove the HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait, unless there's still a use for it we somehow missed.

Nope, never remove things from os-traits.

> Having a trait which noone used in the code for a single release is regrettable, but far from disastrous.

Right.

> The main sunk cost would be all the effort I put into implementing capabilities-to-traits conversion

Not sunk, we needed that anyway.

> a beer in Denver fair payment ;-)

Deal.

> I'd prefer to hear what others think first.  Sean, Matt, Jay, Chris etc. - any opinions?

Yes, I would definitely want others in the conversation before you go to a lot of work to rewrite.

> > By the way, this spec feels really heavy on implementation details to me. Maybe that's intentional.
<snip>
> If you think stuff can be taken out then suggestions are extremely welcome

No; I really don't understand most of it, so I can't say whether it's necessary to include. Definitely defer to the SMEs on that, and they've clearly guided it in this direction, so cool.

Voting to register that we're not done talking through the trait-vs-rc issue."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

> > Remove the HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait, unless there's still a use for it we somehow missed.
> 
> Nope, never remove things from os-traits.

Not even if the trait has never been used, never has a chance of being used, and os-traits has no deprecation mechanism to prevent people from trying erroneously?

I've just submitted a new patch set which ditches the idea of using the trait and proposes removing it, but I can change that if there is compelling rationale for keeping it - just not sure what that might be at this point.

> > The main sunk cost would be all the effort I put into implementing capabilities-to-traits conversion
> 
> Not sunk, we needed that anyway.

Well I said "sunk" not "wasted" ;-)

> > I'd prefer to hear what others think first.  Sean, Matt, Jay, Chris etc. - any opinions?
> 
> Yes, I would definitely want others in the conversation before you go to a lot of work to rewrite.

Sure - I don't think it will be a *huge* amount of work, and certainly not to the extent of being a rewrite, but obviously getting feedback from others ASAP will be very helpful.

> > By the way, this spec feels really heavy on implementation details to me. Maybe that's intentional.
> 
> <snip>
> 
> > If you think stuff can be taken out then suggestions are extremely welcome
> 
> No; I really don't understand most of it, so I can't say whether it's necessary to include. Definitely defer to the SMEs on that, and they've clearly guided it in this direction, so cool.

Got it ;-)

> > Voting to register that we're not done talking through the trait-vs-rc issue.

Ack.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-18 17:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-18 17:55:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

> Not even if the trait has never been used, never has a chance of being used, and os-traits has no deprecation mechanism to prevent people from trying erroneously?

Not even then. The pathological theoretical case is where somebody (not limited to nova) is on 0.11.0 or 0.12.0, sees the trait and uses it for $whatever, then their world breaks when they upgrade to 0.13.0. Pin at 0.12.0? Not if they want to use some new trait introduced after that. Blacklist 0.11.0 and 0.12.0? Can't do that in an already-published release.

And... it's just not that big a deal. I'm only guessing, but I bet there's more than a few traits in there that haven't ever been used, and some that never will be. Shrug.

> I've just submitted a new patch set which ditches the idea of using the trait and proposes removing it

To be clear, I'm not suggesting reinstating use of the trait in this feature. Just saying we need to ignore the fact that the trait exists in os-traits and not worry about trying to remove it.

So - the downvote is to purge any mention of removing the trait from os-traits. I would also prefer we rethink the conf option a little bit, or explicitly punt that discussion to the implementation; but I'll defer to other reviewers' opinions on that."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-18 23:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-18 23:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-22 21:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(3 comments)

Passive-aggressive no-vote for now, for the two issues noted inline.

But I think this is getting real close.'}, {'account_id': 24938, 'date': '2019-04-22 22:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-23 15:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

One final thought: given that we already agreed that providing the trait still has merit, this would provide three different ways to initially request SEV via a flavor extra spec:

(1) encrypt_memory=true
(2) resources:AMD_SEV_CONTEXT=1 or resources:MEM_ENCRYPTED_CONTEXT=1 or similar (depending on the outcome of that discussion)
(3) trait:HW_CPU_AMD_SEV

(1) seems like the clear winner, since (2) is potentially open to misuse with values other than 1, and (3) should not be used unless in conjunction with one of the other two, since by itself it does not take care of the per-host limit.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-23 15:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

@Dan Thanks a lot for all the info and advice.  I've tried to incorporate it into the latest patchset - in particular the new "Memory locking and accounting" section:

http://logs.openstack.org/94/641994/11/check/openstack-tox-docs/a439f50/html/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#memory-locking-and-accounting

Hope it looks good to you now but don't hesitate to critique if you spot anything which still needs work.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-23 15:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

(4 comments)

Relatively minor quibble about describing an inventory amount as a "limit", but overall I support the spec.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-23 17:53:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

> One final thought: given that we already agreed that providing the trait still has merit, this would provide three different ways to initially request SEV via a flavor extra spec:
> 
> (1) encrypt_memory=true
> (2) resources:AMD_SEV_CONTEXT=1 or resources:MEM_ENCRYPTED_CONTEXT=1 or similar (depending on the outcome of that discussion)
> (3) trait:HW_CPU_AMD_SEV
> 
> (1) seems like the clear winner, since (2) is potentially open to misuse with values other than 1, and (3) should not be used unless in conjunction with one of the other two, since by itself it does not take care of the per-host limit.

Yes, this is a good point, it would technically be possible for the request to *land* on the SEV host with any of the three options above. However, at spawn time, the driver also needs to do whatever magic to make the SEV context actually attached to the VM (or however that's phrased). So we declare that we only support (1), and document it thus. And better yet, we add validation such that if (2) or (3) (the latter without corresponding (1)) is given, we error."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-23 17:59:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-23 18:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-23 21:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

ok we have been discussing this on irc. i think there are some minor nits w coudl clean up later but im fine with this verions'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-23 22:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-04-23 23:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(4 comments)

Thanks for all the helpful discussions today. Patch set 12 attempts to capture all the progress we made. Hopefully this is good enough now and any further refinements can be done as follow-ups reviews, although I suspect the remainder now are pretty much implementation details (e.g. the MAXINT one) which could be decided as the code gets written and reviewed.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-23 23:29:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Good.

One thing we discussed that should maybe be mentioned: if we find an explicit placement-ese request for the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT, we should error.

That could be a fup (or just don't forget it in the impl)."}, {'account_id': 24938, 'date': '2019-04-24 00:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-04-24 04:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-24 11:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

yep im still good with this +1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-24 11:28:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I'm happy with this. Thanks for the work and the patience.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-24 14:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

'}, {'created': '2019-04-15 14:40:56.000000000', 'message': 'Re-approve AMD SEV support for Train

Work on AMD SEV support is progressing well:

   https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/amd-sev-libvirt-support

but unfortunately did not quite reach completion in time for the Stein
release.  So re-submit the spec for approval for Train, according to
the process described at:

   https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#previously-approved-specifications

In addition to re-targeting, the following changes to the spec were
made:

- Memory locking is now done using <locked/> element of
  <memoryBacking>. It is changed because, as pointed out in the
  review, we cannot use <hard_limit>;

- Remove mentions of ``_set_features()`` because it had to be
  implemented differently;

- Incorporate a lot of feedback and new information which has arisen
  regarding memory locking and accounting, both in the review and
  elsewhere (mailing lists etc.).

- Cover the per-machine limit for SEV guests (initially via a config
  option, with plans to later auto-detect).

- Drop SEV-ES from the policy.

- Update to take into account work which has already been done.

- Restructure some sections so that the amount of technical detail
  is kept separately in order not to overwhelm the key messages.

Change-Id: I4ad7de08d55ef0d8b74719f60966f545a36a12eb
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Previously-approved: Stein
'}, {'created': '2019-04-16 23:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Re-approve AMD SEV support for Train

   https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/amd-sev-libvirt-support

but unfortunately did not quite reach completion in time for the Stein
release.  So re-submit the spec for approval for Train, according to
the process described at:

   https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#previously-approved-specifications

In addition to re-targeting, the following changes to the spec were
made:

- Memory locking is now done using <locked/> element of
  <memoryBacking>. It is changed because, as pointed out in the
  review, we cannot use <hard_limit>;

- Incorporate a lot of feedback and new information which has arisen
  regarding memory locking and accounting, both in the review and
  elsewhere (mailing lists etc.).

- Switch from a trait-based approach to one based around a new
  SEV_CONTEXT resource class.  This covers the per-machine limit for
  SEV guests (initially via a config option, with plans to later
  auto-detect).

- Remove mentions of ``_set_features()`` because it had to be
  implemented differently;

- Drop SEV-ES from the suggested policy.

- Update to take into account work which has already been done.

- Restructure some sections so that the amount of technical detail
  is kept separately in order not to overwhelm the key messages.

Change-Id: I4ad7de08d55ef0d8b74719f60966f545a36a12eb

   https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#previously-approved-specifications

- Memory locking is now done using <locked/> element of
  <memoryBacking>. It is changed because, as pointed out in the
  review, we cannot use <hard_limit>;

  elsewhere (mailing lists etc.).

commit_message:
Re-approve AMD SEV support for Train

Work on AMD SEV support is progressing well:

   https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/amd-sev-libvirt-support

but unfortunately did not quite reach completion in time for the Stein
release.  So re-submit the spec for approval for Train, according to
the process described at:

   https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#previously-approved-specifications

In addition to re-targeting, the following changes to the spec were
made:

- Memory locking is now done using <locked/> element of
  <memoryBacking>. It is changed because, as pointed out in the
  review, we cannot use <hard_limit>;

- Incorporate a lot of feedback and new information which has arisen
  regarding memory locking and accounting, both in the review and
  elsewhere (mailing lists etc.).

- Switch from a trait-based approach to one based around a new
  MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class.  This covers the per-machine
  limit for SEV guests (initially via a config option, with plans to
  later auto-detect).

- Propose a new extra spec / image property parameter
  hw:mem_encryption which under the hood gets translated to a
  requirement on the new resource class.

- Remove mentions of ``_set_features()`` because it had to be
  implemented differently;

- Drop SEV-ES from the suggested policy.

- Update to take into account work which has already been done.

- Restructure some sections so that the amount of technical detail
  is kept separately in order not to overwhelm the key messages.

Change-Id: I4ad7de08d55ef0d8b74719f60966f545a36a12eb
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Previously-approved: Stein

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I753c3a1167bb8ddae3e9a41b9e4dd8d93d4091ce
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I535d4a092890b1198e625fa2d5d83635d3ff9731
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I81b29590187111cfa9770e4105883c943272a7d1
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Jsonschema 3.0.1: Binding the schema to draft-04

This fix binds the raid schema to draft-04 of the
json schema. The draft-04 is supported on both
jsonschema 2.6 and jsonschema 3.0.1.
Draft-06 and draft-07 require the schema change
which is incompatible with draft-04.

Story: #2005464
task: 30540

Change-Id: Ic30a0f18982f4da939f0f23eef8a233afea0e41a

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6859353c8b79b1e111ec2e13ab8f265e008715b7
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I14400678a53a66e2b0d1a5377d881b9df7dbfc71
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

If we adjust the crush map, we have to re-adjust the crush map after

'}]
commit_message:
Fix the problem that the crush map is changed

When deploying ceph osd with kolla, each osd deployment will move the
host bucket to default in the crush map.

If we adjust the crush map, we have to re-adjust the crush map after
adding osd or fixing osd.
This commit fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ifdc3a1fd5fe37da529b2aee9811b12f744cff3bf
Closes-bug: #1821681
(cherry picked from commit 3d4a7360a7c51a1f1c806a70026a7c8b20e20789)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I92dcc6339f6877f3edffe1c2ce919c5a38b47fa5
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

Update Grafana dashboards for stable Neutron releases

Now that Stein is officially released, update the stable dashboards to
point to the the new latest and previous releases

Also remove periodic jobs that only run on master

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I67f6301eb296fae9fedfea189ceeef42c59280d8
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If5ec0826d9f6b664f71f457b55f1674f8e0848e1
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
WIP: Provide a mechanism for virtual kayobe enviroments

This adds an env-path option to kayobe. Kayobe will source this file
into its enviroment prior to running any commands.

When you pip install your config with the -e flag we can detect the config
source location. This reduces the number of steps needed to use kayobe i.e you
don't need to set KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH and allows you to switch kayobe
environments by simply changing virtualenvs.

Change-Id: I7a297236d184967fcb48187a64e366617b689e9f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/655424
Story: 2004367
Task: 30587

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I88f8c1c8730d4d8f5100e69e6a670f6ee02a158d
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibddd61b7a9e9b78905d548b5ab00e64277449114
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Removal of netloc filters

The ansible urlsplit filter added in 2.4 means that maintaining the
filters netloc, netloc_no_port and netorigin should no longer be
necessary.
All usages of these filters within other openstack repos have been
updated to use urlsplit and merged.

Change-Id: Ief1ec06e205bae7ec114fe0b9bd7d9c4973383dd
Closes-Bug: #1820830

Update networking-ovn dashboard

The openstack-tox-py35-with-ovsdbapp-master job is no longer

update dashboard to use openstack-tox-py36-with-ovsdbapp-master
stats.

commit_message:
Drop use of git.openstack.org

Our cgit instance will be going away and opendev.org is the new
preferred URL for browsing our git repos. Redirects will exist for the
foreseeable future, but it's more efficient to just go directly to the
new locations.

Change-Id: I7dd9d454da63167832bab02c89be98a2ce03b72a

commit_message:
Fix incorrect VPNaaS packages

As of Queens the VPNaaS package to be used is no longer
neutron-vpn-agent and has been replaced with the package
python-neutron-vpnaas.

The package for openswan does not exist for Debian systems
and needs to be updated to strongswan instead.

Change-Id: I859c80facc9dadf461c2300a6c354c73ae60e5e4
Closes-bug: #1825700

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 11:11:57.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that pip/setuptools/wheel python wheels are built

All virtualenvs make use of pip/setuptools/wheel, but none of
them specify that these wheels need to be built and therefore
every venv build process reaches out to pypi to fetch them.

To ensure that the repo container has these built as wheels,
we set the utility container to build them so that these
packages will be available for other venvs to use.

Change-Id: I60f851e1ffa401c92221de14651502306e9b0581
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that pip/setuptools/wheel python wheels are built

All virtualenvs make use of pip/setuptools/wheel, but none of
them specify that these wheels need to be built and therefore
every venv build process reaches out to pypi to fetch them.

To ensure that the repo container has these built as wheels,
we set the utility container to build them so that these
packages will be available for other venvs to use.

Change-Id: I60f851e1ffa401c92221de14651502306e9b0581

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 11:09:21.000000000', 'message': "Check master/backup router status in DVR functional tests

When two routers are created at the same time, we can't assume the
status of each one. Instead of this, the status of each router is
first checked and then compared to the other router status.

Change-Id: If20a3a414986ea29fbfd50616761c14e5b249b2c
Closes-Bug: #1819160
(cherry picked from commit 8f35331c918f83381951fc4367f43b2805d556ef)
"}, {'created': '2019-04-17 11:09:41.000000000', 'message': "Check master/backup router status in DVR functional tests

When two routers are created at the same time, we can't assume the
status of each one. Instead of this, the status of each router is

Change-Id: If20a3a414986ea29fbfd50616761c14e5b249b2c

commit_message:
Check master/backup router status in DVR functional tests

When two routers are created at the same time, we can't assume the
status of each one. Instead of this, the status of each router is
first checked and then compared to the other router status.

Change-Id: If20a3a414986ea29fbfd50616761c14e5b249b2c
Closes-Bug: #1819160
(cherry picked from commit 8f35331c918f83381951fc4367f43b2805d556ef)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 11:09:01.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Support Ceph Nautilus release in puppet-ceph

This patch introduces the changes required by osd configuration tasks to
support Nautilus release:

- ceph-disk has been removed and replaced by ceph-volume
- OSDs can not be based on directories anymore, only disks or vg/lv
paths.
- udev configuration is not needed since some releases back.

Still working to implement CI validation for this, i'll update this
patch.

Change-Id: I15f061dd38ca6729a454ec96c8c8f5ea28c6f0c6

commit_message:
Support Ceph Nautilus release in puppet-ceph

This patch introduces the changes required by osd configuration tasks to
support Nautilus release:

- ceph-disk has been removed and replaced by ceph-volume
- OSDs can not be based on directories anymore, only disks or vg/lv
paths.
- udev configuration is not needed since some releases back.

To pass CI, this job requires to merge [1] and viceversa. To solve
chicken-and-egg, I'm setting p-o-i jobs as non-voting in this patch.
I'll make them voting again after merging both [1] and this one.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650281/

Change-Id: I15f061dd38ca6729a454ec96c8c8f5ea28c6f0c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-11 14:00:03.000000000', 'message': "docker-rm: check if rpm dependency is actually installed

If the deployment wasn't deployed under Docker, python-docker-py package
is missing. Therefore, during the upgrade we don't want to try to remove
the containers under Docker, since they don't exist anyway.

python-docker-py is needed by Ansible to remove the containers, so let's
make sure the package is installed, which is the case when the
deployment was under Docker.
If the rpm doesn't exist, we'll skip the tasks and don't try to remove
the containers.

The main case where docker-rm is useful is when upgrading on centos7
from rocky to stein, since we clear containers running in Docker during
the upgrade, so they run on Podman.

In reality, the future platform won't have Docker installed, so this
role will become useless and we'll probably deprecate it.

Closes-Bug: #1824301
Change-Id: Ic5036ffa756775e3806e18b09e034af2290bfb56

commit_message:
docker-rm: check if rpm dependency is actually installed

If the deployment wasn't deployed under Docker, python2-docker package
is missing. Therefore, during the upgrade we don't want to try to remove
the containers under Docker, since they don't exist anyway.

python2-docker is needed by Ansible to remove the containers, so let's
make sure the package is installed, which is the case when the
deployment was under Docker.
If the rpm doesn't exist, we'll skip the tasks and don't try to remove
the containers.

The main case where docker-rm is useful is when upgrading on centos7
from rocky to stein, since we clear containers running in Docker during
the upgrade, so they run on Podman.

In reality, the future platform won't have Docker installed, so this
role will become useless and we'll probably deprecate it.

Closes-Bug: #1824301

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-18 15:45:22.000000000', 'message': 'Ingress: Add pod/container security context
         - deployment-error.yaml
         - deployment-ingress.yaml

This updates the ingress-error chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template

This also adds the container security context to set
readOnlyRootFilesystem to true

removing readOnlyRootFilesystem flag for ingress since pods are running to
"crashLoopBackOff" state by implementing HTK functionality

Change-Id: I28171d529a27c3f203b02c031a6cf289fcc5f3e6

commit_message:
Ingress: Add pod/container security context

This PS fixes the use of the security context macros for the
ingress chart.

Change-Id: I28171d529a27c3f203b02c031a6cf289fcc5f3e6
